58.description: Phil's is really great pizza!  Very fresh ingredients!  The sausage...oh my.....huge chunks if delicious, fresh meat!  The crust is buttery and crisp.  The sauce is perfect...not too tangy/sweet/salty.  The Phil's team is very nice and cordial, and the restaurant is very clean.  I wish they would deliver to Bronzeville, as we're only 10 minutes away.  However, in the interim, I will continue to happily venture to Bridgeport to pick up my pizza.

56.description: This is my go to pizza place for take out.  Yes the dine in area is lacking.  Yes the service could use  some smiles.  But the pizza itself is the star of the show.  They lay on the toppings and the price is right.  I haven't tried any of the sides or entrees.  I can only attest to the deliciousness of what is known as their thin crust sausage and garlic.  I know it may not sound good.  I balked at that idea myself until I tried it.  Was hooked after my first bite.

29.description: This is a great go to pizza place. Co-workers and I always order it, and I think that it is highly underated.

42.description: Phil's pizza is the best tasting pizza in bridgeport and McKinley Park. Nice, classic, cheesy, greasy. Love the retro Chicago photos in there, too. Only downside is a cash only policy.

23.description: Tried to order delivery.  Person on the phone was rude as heck. Never trying this place again. Sorry but I don't order from jerks.

47.description: Pizza night, the best night of the week!!! We wanted to try something new so we fell upon Phils pizza and ordered a simple yet delicious large sausage pizza.  We made our order for pick up and it was ready in 30 minutes as they said.  This place is NOT stingy with their sausage, just how I like it.  The crust was perfectly crisp and the sauce to cheese ratio was on point.  We ate the left overs the next morning, Breakfast of champions!!!  If you like thin crisp, greasy pizza with a lot of meat, this is the spot.  I'll be back Phil's!

8.description: The Best pizza in Bridgeport, never once in many many years have they ever disappointed my Pie..I been a fan when I use to live in Canaryville and Phils was located on 43rd off Halsted St..the Beefs & Dago Sausage are done right also..now I'm getting hungry just writing this.

31.description: Delicious pizza. We carried out and brought our pizza to Maria's, it was a glorious combo.

34.description: Ignorant employees that make you want to choke them out and make them do The Chicken. The sausage on their pizza is the size of golf balls. It is so delicious I endure the horrible people that work here. My favorite is the sausage and mushroom pizza.

16.description: Best pizza, we order at least 3x a week from here either to my store or home. I am glad I work out 2x a day 6x a week. Small prize to pay just So I can indulge on their pizza.

13.description: Change the ignorant bad attitude cashier! Nasty attitude just to answer a simply question! Now I understand why nobody is in the restaurant eating!

11.description: I also meant to say this neighborhood pizza joint competes and beats the big Chicago names! All the marketing those places do has to compete with 4 pizza ovens and some Chicago pizza makers bar none.....throw some anchovies on there and you'll be back to age 5....Pepperoni,sausage and cheese is to DIE for!!!!

39.description: Stopped there with friends from work for the third time in 2 months.  Pizza was great as usual.  The temp outside was in the single digits so it was really chilly in the dining area!

37.description: Ordered a few weeks ago. A thick curly hair arrived to my house IN my pizza.First and last order il ever make to Phils

0.description: The first time I went to dine in, I wasn't really looking forward to it because the place looks a little shady but everyone was friendly and the pizza is delicious! I'm soooo glad they deliver to my neighborhood.. I didn't expect them to because it's a little far. The delivery man was super sweet and I only wish they took credit/debit cards so that I'd given a bigger tip!

38.description: We just got out pizza delivered to us. It was two hours late and luke warm but it was still delicious. We ordered a large three topping pizza,garlic bread and a 2 liter Pepsi plus delivery for under $25. Nice. And you ask why not 5 stars because unlike everyone else in my house I love extra pizza sauce. Otherwise delicious!!!!!

51.description: I am a fan of pizza. You might say we're involved. So I do NOT like giving a pizza place 2 stars. In fact, it should likely be less, but I just cannot bring myself to give one star to pizza.We arrived, and had to park on the street. The building looks pretty dilapidated, but that has never stopped me before. We went in and ordered a large 'za with half olives and half pepperoni. First things first... They only accept cash but did not tell us until our order was placed, and there were no signs to indicate this. I can handle that, no big deal. It took about 20 minutes for our pizza to be made, so we sat in the restaurant area at one of the tables.The entire establishment was extremely dirty. From the floors which were housing 2 buckets to catch water coming through the roof, to the tables which were absolutely filthy, to the restrooms that literally almost made me vomit.... this place was just dreadful. I am sort of a germiphobe, so it took every ounce of strength I had in me to stay.When our pizza came out, I was so excited! It looked absolutely delicious! But looks can be deceiving, and it was awful. The crust tasted like stale bread, the cheese tasted cheap and rubbery, and the pizza was literally dripping with grease. Even with all of the grease, this pizza had little taste at all to it. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants good pizza, or wants to eat in a somewhat clean environment.

27.description: I have to say that this is probably the best thin crust pizza I've had in my area, when it comes to greasy and tasty it doesn't get much better than their sausage & pepperoni, I've ordered from other places in my neighborhood (south loop) and really it comes down to Phil's unless you want deep dish. And even though they're mildly rude on the phone which is why I deducted a star the quality of their food makes up for it, they're also strictly cash but I don't mind since they're not pricey at all in my opinion. I've also tried their beef and it's pretty good as well, the fries pair up with either the pizza or the beef and if you can make all this work the way they do then I think it's a job well done. They just have to work on their customer service is all, either way I'm still ordering regularly since it's not at a make or break point for me.

32.description: Hmmm, I would've liked to try Phils, but they hung up on me the first time and didn't answer the second time. So I guess if they had answered the phone, I could've experienced their food. Now I just get to rate their POOR customer service.

54.description: Phil's pizza it's where it's at! Great pizza and service in my opinion. Although the cash only can be a headache at times, I don't mind because the pizza is totally worth it! Pizza is always fresh out of the oven even when delivered! I prefer a good spicy pizza and Phil's is always on the money with that. Phil's is my number 2 in Bridgeport for sure!

48.description: Vito and who??? Hands down! No question! Phils is the best pizza in all of Chicago! Not just from me, but everyone else who's had both agrees as well.

44.description: The pizza is always hot when delivered and has an enormous portion of toppings. Their hot wings are actually spicy and the delivery time has always been reasonable. We order from here regularly.

24.description: I was introduced to Phil's Pizza by my boyfriend. I lived in the city of Chicago for awhile now and have tried multiple pizza places. Phil's by far is the best pizza I have had. We go at least twice month or even more. The staff knows us by name. They see us walk in the door and great us nicely. All these negative reviews are not very accurate. They are constantly busy from the moment they open. I love Phil's and will continue to go.

7.description: I live on the North side but I will faithfully drive down to Phil's for pizza. Tasty sauce, good quality cheese, nice & crispy crust. If you find a better pizza in Chicago then please, let me know! Also, it's cash only!

49.description: Wow ten years living in the neighborhood and today my first time eating this pizza is like I believe in god again

40.description: Price is a bit high but you pay for what you get!! If you are ever in Bridgeport try it. They don't skimp on the toppings at all!

53.description: I write this review as my family finishes the last pizza from Phil's we'll ever buy.Here is my story.Earlier this evening, none of the adults in our house wanted to get off our chubby cabooses to cook a healthy meal. Pizza night. We have had pizza from Phil's a few times but each time had been delivery. It was a cool summer night out so we decided we would pick it up this time instead.I called in my order and spoke to a man on the phone. The time was 7:20 pm. A large special was ordered after a brief discussion. 30 minutes, he said. No, wait. He changed his mind. Better make it 40 minutes. I said, no problem.I showed up at 8:10ish pm and made my way to the counter. There was one family of 4 having their dinner at a table and 3 other customers waiting for their take-out/pick-up order. The family of 4 will come into play later.Behind the counter was a young Hispanic with her hair tied back in a pony tail. She looked busy as she called out an order for someone to come pick up. She asked me my name and I responded. "Its not ready." she said and she turned away before I could even ask her how much longer it would take. She retreated into the kitchen where it looked like there was about 4 or 5 people making pizzas frantically. I decided not to wait for her to return and grabbed a seat in the diner. Customer after customer walked in and asked about their take-out and every response from the woman was "It's not ready". And each time, she would turn away as quickly as she could to retreat to the kitchen.Now, I've worked in a restaurant before. I understand that a kitchen can get backed up and things can fall apart pretty quickly. The woman didn't handle the customers very well but at this point, I just thought she was ill-trained and maybe a little rude. This would change later.After waiting for about 15 minutes, I decided to face the rude woman behind the counter. I walked up and waited for her to come back and asked her how long it would take. She asked for my name again and before my lips could even finish forming the last syllable, she responded."It's not ready."Here's where the family of 4 comes in. The father behind me must have raised his hand to signal for her because at this point she leaned around me and asked him what he needed. Apparently, he wanted another 2 liter of Pepsi because she went to go get it for him. I waited."I understand its not ready, but how much longer will it be?"With an irritated huff, she went into the kitchen and looked on their table of order slips. Without even turning to face me, she shouted "5 minutes". Rude? What's worst than rude? Whatever it is, she's riding that border like a pro at this point. At this point, the dining room has 8 other customers waiting. I went back to my game of 2048 on my phone and just waited. At 8:40 pm, I finally heard my name called. Here's where the story actually gets uglier.There was an elderly woman there who had been waiting before I even arrived. She got up and very irately began to complain how people who arrived after her were getting their food before her. Rightly so. The young woman with the pony tail responded by saying her food wasn't ready and that phone orders were at 40 minutes. Remember, I got there at 8:10 pm and it was now 8:40 pm. This poor woman had to have been waiting for more than 40 minutes in that waiting room now. At this point, the elderly woman was visibly angry because she thinks she's being mistreated. In response, the woman with the pony tail laughs. Yah. She laughs. I was stunned. I look into the kitchen to see if anybody there was "Phil" or a manager or something had seen this. The closest man to the front was at the pizza oven. He had heard. And he was also laughing.Phil's Pizza is good. It is. But the employees/managers/owner there aren't rude. No, this isn't rudeness. It's contempt. They believe that they can laugh in an elderly woman's face because they're Phil's Pizza. They are hurtful and they are dishonorable. At some point, you have to decide whether good pizza is worth supporting a business that would hurt another person just because they can.We have leftovers. I think I'm just going to throw it away. Phil's Pizza doesn't taste so good anymore.

30.description: Phil's pizza is one of the best pizza place in Bridgeport. They put sooo much topping for such a great low price. Cash only would only be the only downside to Phil's.

46.description: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE....CHECK YOUR ORDER!!! I ordered a half and half pizza today and didn't receive what I ordered. When I called back the rep who took my order remembered my order and apologized. She told me that I can get a $5 credit or bring the pizza back... I brought it back not knowing I was gonna have to pay for another pizza because my family didn't want the incorrect one. ..we never touched one slice of the Wrong pizza... I brought it back and she said $14 bucks... I was lost and Mindy the rep was lost too. She knew that was Wrong and told me $10... Then when I called again after I realized I was bamboozled a guy said I should've eaten the right side since I ended up paying again... smh.... if I was Told I was gonna pay for a new pie less $5... I definitely would have eaten the correct side and only returned the wrong one.... just drove 8 miles to pay for another pizza that they made incorrectly the first time.... I ordered a pizza at 6pm didn't eat till 12am... Customer Service goes along way so I don't think I will be bragging about Phil's Pizza anymore......smh... Just didn't seem fair to cheat the customer!!! Especially if they messed up the order!! $34 for one Large pizza... yeah they got over on me and after reading other reviews... I'm just gonna take it as a loss on cash and a good pizza joint.

1.description: atmosphere is actually pretty cool - i think it used to be a bank. pizza was good, affordable - 14 bucks for a pepperoni pizza, garlic bread, and a liter of soda. i think the same woman who others have complained about took my order, but i thought she was pretty funny. she also had a good rapport with other people who came in, and i could tell that most of the people who were there were regulars/came in ofter and she knew them. all in all, a cool neighborhood joint that i will definitely be returning to.also, like every else has said - bring cash! there is an ATM in the restaurant but i am sure the fee is outrageous.

55.description: one of the best places for thin crust in the city, their crust is thick, very similar to beggar's, you get a healthy amount of toppings as well, and the peppers are sliced and not diced, in addition it's very reasonably priced for the amount you get, definitely the best pizza place in bridgeport

9.description: I really enjoyed this pizza!!! I was amazed on how delicious this pizza was.  I haven't enjoyed a good pizza in a very long time.  Had small sausage pizza.  Fries sucked though, arrived cold and they weren't tasty.  Other then that great pizza!

26.description: this pizza place does not give a fuck about you... understand?they do not care about customers and will eventually go out of businessno credit/debit cards accepted!!! they don't want your money!!!!!they are too LAZY to set up a simple swipe card machine to accept debit/credit cards.or they are trying to cheat on their taxes by being "cash only" they don't wanna pay taxes but screw you, you pay taxes, not them, right?

25.description: Not the cheeriest group you'll ever meet, and certainly nothing special when it comes to atmosphere, but they will serve you a pizza that can't be denied. My girlfriend and I were staying close to here at an Airbnb for a recent music festival and honestly, we ate dinner here two nights because of how much we enjoyed it.

12.description: Priced, prepared and served in your favorite style of cut (slices ir squares), Phil's Pizza is old-school pizza that takes some of us down memory lane, when mom & pop pizza joints were neighborhood fixtures. Phil's Pizza delivers on quality, quantity, and toppings and customer service a the way things were done before computers were running everything, and real people interacted, and it was a good thing!Whenever I want that thin crust pizza that completely satisfies, Phil's Pizza will get my call. Did I mention cash-only? Totally old-school.

59.description: Late night, looking for some serious south side pizza? Stop by this joint. They hooked my wife and I up! We had some veggie pizza (We had decided to forgo meat for the week), and though this was against my very being, it was actually darned tasty! Looking forward to my next journey into the city for a pizza treat!

21.description: Had a craving for pizza and decided to try a new place. I had a small pepperoni pizza. I saw the reviews for best pizza in Chicago. I wouldn't go that far but it was good pizza....lol. FYI the pizza comes in a bag instead of a box so be gentle when driving.

17.description: Its a little mom & pop joint that only accepts cash. If you are a fan of Chicago style pizza-- this is the spot!

10.description: All i got too say is you see it looks good taste even better. Had chesse sausage an pepperoni o my it's good

5.description: On a visit to Chicago I promised my daughter we would have an original Chicago pizza, and Phil's didn't let us down.We ordered the medium cheese. The cheese and sauce were top notch. The crust was more towards a traditional "savory" style. Unlike the sweeter modern crust. There is a large simple dinning room for busy Friday and Saturday nights.The staff was friendly and easy to talk to.

3.description: Going to make this short and sweet...Best pizza on the Southside! And, they were open Christmas Eve to deliver me a pizza after a long day's work. Thank you.I will come back to add more later but that made me so happy I had to post now.

35.description: Once in a very very blue moon I splurge allowing myself pizza & calories. ..... sadly mine just wasn't worth it today ; ( crust was hard and dry like cardboard.  Something wasn't right.

19.description: I am a fan of pizza. You might say we're involved. So I do NOT like giving a pizza place 2 stars. In fact, it should likely be less, but I just cannot bring myself to give one star to pizza.We arrived, and had to park on the street. The building looks pretty dilapidated, but that has never stopped me before. We went in and ordered a large 'za with half olives and half pepperoni. First things first... They only accept cash but did not tell us until our order was placed, and there were no signs to indicate this. I can handle that, no big deal. It took about 20 minutes for our pizza to be made, so we sat in the restaurant area at one of the tables.The entire establishment was extremely dirty. From the floors which were housing 2 buckets to catch water coming through the roof, to the tables which were absolutely filthy, to the restrooms that literally almost made me vomit.... this place was just dreadful. I am sort of a germiphobe, so it took every ounce of strength I had in me to stay.When our pizza came out, I was so excited! It looked absolutely delicious! But looks can be deceiving, and it was awful. The crust tasted like stale bread, the cheese tasted cheap and rubbery, and the pizza was literally dripping with grease. Even with all of the grease, this pizza had little taste at all to it. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wants good pizza, or wants to eat in a somewhat clean environment.

28.description: Priced, prepared and served in your favorite style of cut (slices ir squares), Phil's Pizza is old-school pizza that takes some of us down memory lane, when mom & pop pizza joints were neighborhood fixtures. Phil's Pizza delivers on quality, quantity, and toppings and customer service a the way things were done before computers were running everything, and real people interacted, and it was a good thing!Whenever I want that thin crust pizza that completely satisfies, Phil's Pizza will get my call. Did I mention cash-only? Totally old-school.

45.description: Great pizza but RUDE and RACIST staff! I ate in and noticed how the staff (older lady) greeted every white customer with a "hello ma'am, hello sir, Yes Sir, Yes Ma'am".  Every other customer wasn't even greeted and all of their responses to them were short and cold.  Racism is alive and well in Bridgeport.

33.description: Seriously???  Have had pizza all over Chicago and this is the most over rated pizza I've ever had. Not terrible, average at best.

43.description: Woman at counter was incredibly rude, almost considered leaving. This place has an overwhelming smell of burnt dough. Horrible ambiance, all I can hear is the staff talking about their thyroid problems. Would give one star but the food was okay, pizza is really greasy and bland.  the menu is very underwhelming. There aren't a lot of toppings to choose from and it bugs me that it says "sandwich's" on the menu. Even if the staff had been polite this place does not earn 3 stars in my opinion.

2.description: The place is located in a shady like place, but the pizza is to die for. I do not know what blend of cheese they use but the pizza is good cold or hot. The generous helping of meat that Phil's pizza gives compared to other pizza joints is a difference you can notice. The tomato sauce could clearly be tasted so I am very happy about that. Overall the pizza is great, I would recommend anyone to try their pizza.The restaurant dining is much left to be desired. The tables are plain and it seems like it was not meant to have people sit down and eat. This is a place you clearly want to do a pick up and eat at home kind of place. Also be careful of the times they are busy. When they are it takes them an extra 15-20 min to get your order ready. The delivery time is not much better, expect 1hr 30 min to 2hr 30 min delivery times. I find that it is much faster picking it up.Phil's pizza only accepts cash, so be ready to have some on hand.

18.description: Hmmm, I would've liked to try Phils, but they hung up on me the first time and didn't answer the second time. So I guess if they had answered the phone, I could've experienced their food. Now I just get to rate their POOR customer service.

41.description: Really good thin crust South Side pizza. Lots of flavor... Possibly the most toppings I've ever seen (so much sausage!) The reason I can't give it five stars is that the sausage didn't have all that much flavor. As you work your way to the outside of the slice, the taste changes from savory to sweet as there is a higher sauce to cheese ratio, so the flavors change within each slice and you don't get bored. The restaurant is as no frills as it gets. No cups, no tap water, just tin foil, a pizza in paper and a bottle of soda. Classic south side pizza place.

52.description: Some good solid thin crust pizza.  It's pretty damn greasy, especially if you get their sausage but so delicious.  Perfect amounts of cheese and they stack their meat on.They are pretty old school and can come off rude on the phone at first but don't let that stop you from ordering from here.  The jumbo pizza is HUGE.  I usually get the sausage with garlic.  They usually load it with both, so you should probably ask for easy garlic.

50.description: Five stars all around. The pizza here was great and the service was prompt. The sauce wasn't too sweet or spicy. We had garlic and tomatoes, great combination. I would highly recommend this great neighborhood pizza place.

4.description: The pizza speaks for itself. It's my first time eating Phils pizza. Only problem is the annoying/rude short girl who takes the orders. She has an attitude when taking orders. Regardless, I will still order pizza again. The sausage pizza is AMAZING. My family and I will probably just order delivery next time so we don't have to deal with the rude girl behind the counter.

6.description: Officially one of my favs. And I'm a Chicago pizza snob and difficult to please. TONS of toppings. So much that the middle crust couldn't hold up to it. But still pretty good. Beggars is now overpriced, this is a great alternative

22.description: We ordered tomatoes and sausage...They tend to go a little crazy with the sausage. The pizza is good but the tomatoes tasted like they had gone bad.

15.description: The pizza is delicious here. I always order it to go, and I get it pretty quickly. The only bad thing is that sometimes the person taking the orders is rude and can rush you as well. Other than that great place. Their sausage is awesome as well.

57.description: If I can give them a zero I would have. They messed up my order by saying it was never called in. Then, once I placed my order again, I asked if they accepted debit. Maybe I should have said debit card, because once I got there they said they ONLY accepted cash? Lames! What kind of business only accepts cash? A dirty one! Never again will I order here.

20.description: Get the supreme. Loaded with goodness. Every time I visit Chicago I make a stop, or two, at Phil's pizza!

36.description: I love Phil's Pizza. I live in Sauganash and when I'm on the south side I'll order then pick up a pizza. What a treat.

14.description: Get the supreme. Loaded with goodness. Every time I visit Chicago I make a stop, or two, at Phil's pizza!

1.description: My 2nd visit was also awesome & tasty. Brought a friend... Warned her it was a dive/diner (not surrounded by decor or anything). She wanted to eat there/stay. We did. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!! He was friendly & we enjoyed every bit. He has a warm spirit & an honest energy about him... I was very happy with the meal (GREAT PRICES BTW). P.S. No flies were n the window, at all.

2.description: Dive that is located just across the street from Fairplay. Aaron S. and i stopped in today for a quick bite before shopping, because shopping on an empty tummy is no fun. It's tiny inside, there was only one man manning the grill.  No AC either, which meant our stay was uncomfortably warm. It was also kinda busy, but we still didn't have to wait long, the grill man was very quite good at being a grill man. He was also pretty friendly, saying to us right after we walked in and handing us paper menus. They also don't bring your food to you, so just be advised that if you are not sitting at the counter you'll have to get up and get your meal. The place really has no ambiance or anything. Its in a simple room with simple signs on the wall and simple booths that are the kind that sit on the wall. Just a dive. The food is also served on plastic plates. The food was decent though. I very much enjoyed my gyro. It wasn't overly greasy, and the grill man actually put the meat on the grill for a few minutes which made some of the meat kinda crispy, which was a nice touch. The fries were also very good. Shoestring style. Aaron S. got the double cheese burger. Prices are quite cheap. Lunch only was eleven bucks for the two of us. Portions were small After leaving Aaron pointed out something kinda gross to me. On the window sill on the inside were tons of dead flies. Gross! So I'm guessing the place really could stand to be a bit cleaner.

0.description: My girlfriend often asks me how I'm still alive - usually referring to the kinds of things I eat and my lack of attention to cleanliness and the danger zone and other such things.  (That's why she's in the food service industry and I industrially consume food that is served to me.)The fact is that I often don't care about those things, as long as the food is good.  Which is not to say that flavor and taste can make up for unsanitary conditions - but it gets me pretty far down that road and somehow I'm not dead yet.  So my stomach gets a lot of practice fighting off things I've ingested.Speaking of which - we wound up at Big Ray's Grill today while out shopping at Fairplay.  If it weren't for the fact that the grill and kitchen area is in plain view of the patrons, I'd swear this place would be on one of those Shock Video specials about chefs doing gross things to your food.  The guy who served us and took our order and cooked the food seemed to me like one of those guys who puts on a very nice face because he relies on customers to stay in business, but would just as soon turn around and do something to your food if you pissed him off in any way.  "Surly" seems like an apt word to describe him.If you look around, the decorations in this diner are two flavors: pictures of the deceased owner, Big Ray, and menus and specials on pieces of paper.  None of which are located in the menu, so you should really leave the menu alone and just stare at the walls for a while until you find something that tickles your fancy.We went with the Double-Cheeseburger and Fries for me and she went with the Gyro Sandwich Special with fries and a large drink.(Some of the specials randomly have small drinks, medium drinks and large drinks.  I have no clue why some come with large and some with small, but I guess a deal's a deal, right?)I looked around while she sat at the table waiting for the food.  (That was a mistake on my part, and I'll explain later.)  Our food was plated up and he gave us salt/pepper and a squeeze-bottle of ketchup for the fries.  I honestly have to give this guy credit for the burger.  The bun was not only lightly grilled on the bottom to provide a small layer of grease/fat to prevent meat juice and condiments from making the bun soggy, but he also grilled the TOP of the bun, adding flavor and warmth and just a bit more grease.  Aside from a gigantic pickle slice that was taller than the meat and I ate separately, it was a rather excellent burger.  If it were increased in size by about 30% and each patty were more than 1/4-pound or so, it might even make my list of favorite burgers (that I need to make soon).  I also enjoyed the fries, except for the fact that he added pepper as well as salt.  I'm not a fan of pepper, and it wasn't really enough to noticeably taste it, but it threw me for a loop.  Aside from that, the fries were tasty and nicely-fried.  Well-done would have been a better option, but not something you ask for on the first visit.  Gotta get a feel for the place.Unfortunately, I doubt we'll be back again.  I was put off by the lack of proper temperature control.  It was already hot and muggy outside, and the atmosphere inside was exactly the same, plus the steam from the grill and such.  And of course, the "solution" that these no-temp-control locations employ is the "leave the door wide open" tactic.  Which creates a minor breeze at best and of course lets in the flies.  They thankfully stayed away from my food while we were eating, but I counted three live flies while we were there.Why did I count the "live flies"?  Because there were DEAD flies.  During my walk-around, I considered moving us to a table by the window with chairs instead of the benches, and that's when I saw the fly graveyard.  Just tens of large dead flies, belly-up and sitting on the ledge by the window right by the table where people eat their food.And yes, I SAW this and still ATE my food a few minutes later.  And I waited until AFTER she ate and we left the restaurant to take her back to the outside of the window so she could look in and see what I saw.And again, I'm torn.  The service was friendly (that we saw).  The food was tasty (worth coming back for).  But the cleanliness and atmosphere?  Atrocious.  As I told her as we were walking away - maybe I'd consider coming back in the winter.  I doubt he'd have much heat control, so a seat on the stools by the grill would be warm, and the door would be closed so there'd be no flies.(Oh, and I should mention they're cash only and there's no ATM inside.)So I enjoyed the food and there's a chance we'll be back someday when the conditions are better.  And frankly, our stomachs are only stronger for what we've been through.  After all, the only way our bodies can become strong enough to fight off bacteria and infections is to give it lots of practice.  And that's why I'm still alive.(And if I die soon, someone can please posthumously update my review.)

1.description: I do not recommend this service an products not even if they give them free! I got a table and chairs all are broken and this in 2 years period. I got a mattress for 900$ super deal and now have big

2.description: AUUUGGGHHHHHHH! I went there a couple of months ago to buy some cheap linens, and they have shut down totally! Waaaaahhhhh!!!!

0.description: You have to be in the mood to shop here.  You have to be willing to dig, especially for fashions.  You have to be willing to endure crowding, messy aisles, and frustratingly long lines at the checkout, especially on weekends.  It's definitely downscale.  But there is a place for this type of shopping.  Granted, it's not as satisfying as a good day at the thrift store, but some things are better found here than at a thrift store, especially if you are on a tight budget.For example, I would hesitate to buy sheets and towels at a thrift store, but would not hesistate to buy them here.  They have a good selection of sheets, towels, and window treatments here.  Same with socks, underwear, sleepwear.Their "gourmet foods" section has a lot to be desired, especially compared to other Value Cities I've been to.  Overpriced, bad selection.Sometimes I can find clothing and shoes, but the brands tend not to be very cool, unless you are a teen.  They have lots of cheap styles for teens.  The shoe selection is good, but tend toward the really cheap and not so current styles.  Though you never know.  Once in a while you find a great deal.   I have found some nice clothing bargains here,  like a wool coat for $39.00 or two pairs of jeans for $30 (buy one, get one half price).I wouldn't go out of my way to shop here, but when I need just that kind of shopping fix, this can be the place.

28.description: Wow, I have to say the I'm more than pleasantly surprised! Not going to lie: a Chinese place in a plaza near a gas station raised red flags; but I was desperate. I had an impromptu gathering at my house, knew I didn't have time to cook, so decided order food. China Express had good reviews and is close to home, so decided to give it a try. The staff was super friendly (and funny) & helped me decide/order the appropriate amount of food for my mini-party.  Moreover, the food was tasty, hot & fresh. I'd originally given the disclaimer to my friends, "I haven't tried this place before;" but at the first bite, they said it was delicious. No.1's now my only place for neighborhood Chinese!

1.description: This is my go-to place for chinese delivery in the Bridgeport area.Why? because the food is decent and it comes relatively quick.  My go-to is the Kung Pao chicken dinner, they have it loaded with the perfect amount of chicken.  sometimes chinese delivery places don't put enough and you're left eating a bunch of veggies, but not here.Also with the dinner you get fried race and your choice of an eggroll or crab ragoon.  You get a ton of food for the price and it always gets delivered hot.  I did try the hot & sour soup though and wasn't a big fan.For the price and the amount of food you get, you can't beat it for delivery.

9.description: I had the small curry*brown* tofu, nice assortment of veggies, large portion for a small, came with white rice. It was good. Four stars instead of three because I really enjoyed spring rolls, they were perfect. I will definitely eat here again.

29.description: Ordered tonight for the first time and was pleasantly surprised to find a yelp coupon for a $20.00 certificate for $10.00. Delivery was quick and driver was professional and courteous. We had Crab Rangoon, Spring Rolls, Veggie Egg Foo Yung, Shrimp Fried Rice  and Mongolian Chicken.  Everything was good. Not like omg its the best I ever had good, but it was good none the less. I will definitely be ordering from them again for my Hyde Park Chinese food delivery needs.

23.description: So I read the great reviews on this place and decided to order some beef teriyaki sticks, buffalo spicy wings, and the onion pepper steak.  I was going to pick it up the. I decided on delivery and the girl said he should be here in a few minutes. Now mind you I called for delivery AFTER the food was ready and when she said soon a few minutes it was almost 30 min later I called and then she tells me their regular delivery is about 45 min and I'm like wait; I talked to you 25 min ago and you said he should be here shortly. Okaaay. So I finally get the food it's hot so I'm happy . The wings were big and a lot good for the price BUT very very soggy . The beef teriyaki sticks looked like the sauce was dehydrated and burnt into the meat( looked like the strips dogs play with ) and tasted the same. I can say the onion pepper steak was good BUT the shrimp fried rice tasted old and there were like 3 and a half shrimp.  Sorry but the best place hands down on Chinese food for me above this place AND Chinatown is on roosevelt and wabash!

5.description: Did a call in for my lunch ..House fried rice cooked with light soy sauce.. its was yummy

31.description: This is my go to place to Chinese. FORGET China Kitchen OR Royal Kitchen. I only do delivery though.I find this food the quintessential style of Chinese American food. The Spring Rolls are crispy and delicious with a veggie mix. The lo mein are perfect in the preparation and the mongolian spicy chicken has the perfect spice mixture.This tastes low in sodium as well :-)Delivery min is $10 and the delivery fee is $2.50

25.description: The low mein wasn't low mein just fat noodles and the gravy was watered down. The orange chicken wasn't good. And everything was over priced.the shrimp fried rice was plain.never  ordering there again.

12.description: Ordered delivery from here off of GrubHub. Not a huge chinese fan but really had a craving for crab rangoon and fried shrimp w/ rice lol. So weird but I had to have it. I feel like those are the signatures that should never be messed up. I've had them messed up plenty of times. They were absolutely delicious here. I wish I was more open to the rest of the items so I could try them. Maybe eventually but this I'm happy with :)

21.description: Not bad - This review is for a delivery order.*Crab Rangoon - ok, nothing special*Mongolian beef - good*Sesame chicken - pretty good, all meat but I could have gone for a few vegetables, definitely a value (in the future, I will plan to add a bag of steamed broccoli to it)*Wonton soup - pretty tasty, but I have definitely had better, although it was very good considering the priceFor 'small' sizes, the portions were extremely generous.  We got so much food for $25 (including delivery fee and tip). There were three of us, and we still had leftovers. I brought the food home, and my brother thought the sesame chicken was awesome.  The sesame chicken with white rice was my favorite.

16.description: Not bad - This review is for a delivery order.*Crab Rangoon - ok, nothing special*Mongolian beef - good*Sesame chicken - pretty good, all meat but I could have gone for a few vegetables, definitely a value (in the future, I will plan to add a bag of steamed broccoli to it)*Wonton soup - pretty tasty, but I have definitely had better, although it was very good considering the priceFor 'small' sizes, the portions were extremely generous.  We got so much food for $25 (including delivery fee and tip). There were three of us, and we still had leftovers. I brought the food home, and my brother thought the sesame chicken was awesome.  The sesame chicken with white rice was my favorite.

17.description: Chop Suey had a "tinny" taste, Broccoli from Beef & broccoli was way too soft & soggy.  Crab Rangoon was also soggy.  Never ordering from here again.  Took 1 hour for delivery.

10.description: On point! The beef sticks/crab rangoon and fried rice are delicious

11.description: The food isn't good, but for the price you ignore it. Greasy, soggy, and salty about sums it up.However,the one star is for the horrid service. I placed an order, an hour later it had not arrived. When I called to see what was going on, my order had been canceled since I apparently was supposed to meet the delivery driver downstairs. Uh, -15 degrees? Me thinks, 'Heck no!' So, they won't get be getting my business, and I will save my arteries from complete blockage.And...I'm still waiting for the refund. :/

26.description: Menu items I've tried:- Crab Rangoons (pretty good)- Teriyaki Beef Sticks (pretty good, although a little chewy)- Chicken Wings (not good, mainly they are huge, scary looking)- WONTON SOUP (OUT OF THIS WORLD, DELICIOUS), it has chinese cabbage, delicious wontons(shrimp and pork) and shredded BBQ pork in a tasty clear broth, you have to try.- Veggie Egg Foo Young (wouldn't order again)- Mongolian Shrimp (delicious, great sauce, not enough shrimp)- Orange Chicken (not better than Panda Express)- Chow Fun w/ Beef (delicious, generous with the meat)So basically, I would purposely go to this restaurant for the wonton soup, to me it's better than most Chinatown restaurants'.

27.description: Found them on grubhub. Delivery took 50mins.The food was warm and good. The delivery driver would not come to my apartment door. "It's not safe to come to the door": Really? I didn't read that policy on the info page.Why does your company offer delivery service at night? Luckily, I always pay the tip in cash and he didn't receive one. If I'm paying $3 for delivery and I'm going to give you another $3 dollars as a tip, do you really expect me to walk down the stairs for my food? No!!

0.description: The food and servings aren't bad. So far we have had a good experience. I like they offer a discount code for the 1st order and one for orders after that!

20.description: Best Chicken wings in the Area.My favorite dish is  the Fried Tofu in Lobster Sauce.For dessert, you have to try the Mango Mousse Cake.

19.description: It's a no-fuss chinese take-out. As "don't want to cook today" places go, this one was certainly passable. Their wonton soup was far too salty and I love wonton soup. I had to toss it out and anyone that knows me, will attest to how big a deal that is.The dumplings were salty too, but considering there was hardly any filling in it, it didn't bother too much. I'd go back to them in a pinch because their food isn't as greasy as my regular, but I wouldn't recommend this place.

2.description: I have had no issues with this restaurant  until today. I called to order  my usual order. This time it took 10 min for the person to get my order correct (or so i thought). Then my order gets here and the delivery guy  rings my doorbell constantly as if he is playing with it which i found very rude and inappropriate. He comes up and i noticed something was missing from my order. He came to my door with an awful attitude. So i called the restaurant  and spoke with Angel (The manager supposedly) and i told her that he had an awful attitude and her response was "Oh he's  just frustrated  because he has to train another driver". When dealing with people and running a business, customer service is everything. Any attitudes are to be left at the door before interacting with a customer. So i felt that her response  was very inappropriate. She then says " well he'll  be back with the remainder of your order.So here's where it gets worse.This gentleman texts me from his phone  to mine and left me a very disturbing text message. (YES I KEPT IT FOR PROOF). He literally texted me and not only made a mockery of the situation but called me a bitch. I call the restaurant  back and let Angel know and she seems very unbothered almost as if she doesn't  know how to handle the situation. I don't  think she understands the severity  of the issue and how far this can go. But i fault her for telling  him what i said and making it clear that it was me as he could have come back and did anything to me. I mean he went as far as sent me a nasty text message.She did not offer to credit my account for the missing part of my order or anything. But i will be calling the police to report him and i will be contacting the Better Business Bureau and reporting this business.I will never eat here again. I've  ordered here waaaay too many times to get something like this happen to me..

32.description: Fast delivery with only a $10 delivery minimum. Combo specials are a great deal which includes shrimp fried rice and an egg roll. General Tso and sesame chicken are tasty. The  chicken wings are inexpensive and include French fries, too.One thing I didn't like was that the styrofoam delivery containers are stapled shut. That means they're hard to rip open but also there's the risk of swallowing a staple.Nonetheless, the price is right and the food is delicious. I would definitely order from them again.

18.description: We had had decent experiences at this restaurant for a while. Finally a non-disgusting chinese delivery place. That changed a couple of months ago. We had three consecutive horrible experiences. Either the management has changed or the chef, but it's officially inedible.

13.description: Best Chicken wings in the Area.My favorite dish is  the Fried Tofu in Lobster Sauce.For dessert, you have to try the Mango Mousse Cake.

4.description: If I could give zero I would. We ordered from here and it took almost 2 hours to get to me, we live 9 minutes from the restaurant. When the food arrived it was cold- which could be over looked because that seemed to be the delivery service issue. First the veggie egg roll was soggy, tasteless and gross.. You know things are bad when fried dough isn't even enjoyable.I've eaten cardboard with more flavor than the  Mao pao tofu. It was inedible. The shrimp lo mein ordered with extra veggies seemed to be made with grocery store brand spaghetti, and what was included did not resemble "extra" anything.The veggie fried rice was the only thing in the meal that had any sort of taste and that's the best I can say about it.

24.description: We wanted cheap Chinese takeout, and thanks to the Yelp deal we found this gem.We got the orange chicken, general tso chicken, veggie fried rice, crab rangoons, egg drop soup and a complimentary slice of cake.Everything was great. I didn't like the soup but I usually don't like egg drop anyway. The orange chicken was fantastic and just what I was craving. I don't know if they did this in purpose or accident, but we ordered a small serving of most things but we received a large order. Thanks, guys! We got SO much food for the money, and now 24 hours later we are still eating it. The guys at the counter were nice and accommodating, and thanks to their service we will be making the trip from Logan Square to the south side just for them.

6.description: This was my first time ordering! I order through the yelp app.. Delivery was a bit long or maybe it just felt that way bc I was totally hungover! The fried rice was perfect for my situation ! Actually very good! O and the won ton soup is good as well! Nothing too fancy about this but hey it's just fried rice ! I will def order from this again!

22.description: It's a no-fuss chinese take-out. As "don't want to cook today" places go, this one was certainly passable. Their wonton soup was far too salty and I love wonton soup. I had to toss it out and anyone that knows me, will attest to how big a deal that is.The dumplings were salty too, but considering there was hardly any filling in it, it didn't bother too much. I'd go back to them in a pinch because their food isn't as greasy as my regular, but I wouldn't recommend this place.

15.description: We wanted cheap Chinese takeout, and thanks to the Yelp deal we found this gem.We got the orange chicken, general tso chicken, veggie fried rice, crab rangoons, egg drop soup and a complimentary slice of cake.Everything was great. I didn't like the soup but I usually don't like egg drop anyway. The orange chicken was fantastic and just what I was craving. I don't know if they did this in purpose or accident, but we ordered a small serving of most things but we received a large order. Thanks, guys! We got SO much food for the money, and now 24 hours later we are still eating it. The guys at the counter were nice and accommodating, and thanks to their service we will be making the trip from Logan Square to the south side just for them.

7.description: I did not like it!  Ordered via Eat24... Mongolian beef - Edible....The pineapple chicken was not good at all, the beef fried rice was sub par as the beef that was very light in color and looked boiled, the fried shrimp omg disgusting... first of all where's the shrimp?!  Secondly, it was so soggy with grease that i cannot even begin to describe the flavor as i've never tasted anything like it.  It was awful, the egg rolls I didn't even give a chance, over all 33 dollars down the train :(

8.description: The food was great! I ordered here and had it delivered. I ordered on a Thursday around 9:30 on GrubHub. I didn't realize that they close at 10 and felt bad afterward. I received my food at about 10:20ish. I was just glad they didn't call and cancel my order! Everything tasted super fresh too! The egg rolls were great, shrimp fried rice amazing, and egg foo young was delicious too! I will definitely order from you guys again.. Thank you :)

30.description: After searching for some decent Chinese delivery in Hyde Park, we took a chance after a deal on Yelp. It was decent. It wasn't the best Chinese food I've ever had, far from the worst though. The crab ragoon and spring rolls were very yummy. We both got seasame chicken and it was pretty good. They don't give you a lot of rice though- so if you're like me and want more than a tablespoon of rice, make sure to order some extra. The delivery driver didn't have change for a $20, which I felt bad about because that meant he didn't get a tip, since I paid with the Yelp deal I bought. He was very nice and gracious about it. As my roommate declared, "I'd order from here again." Not overwhelmingly amazing, but that's a seal of approval in this apartment.

3.description: I ordered around 4:00pm and the expected time was 45-60 but the business texted and told me they were going to be late and will be here at 5:23. The delivery man came before that but when he came I noticed something was missing, my smoothie. I expected them to check the receipt and get the WHOLE order. So then I told the delivery man to run and bring it back, and he said 10 minutes. I ordered orange chicken. It's ok but doesn't have all of the flavor of orange chicken . Also most meals come with fried rice but my came with white rice.

14.description: Fast delivery! I had the dinner combo sesame chicken, which was about 7.50 and a very generous portion size.  The sesame sauce was good and tasty although the chicken could have been crunchier. It comes with a huge side of shrimp fried rice or you can substitute chicken, beef, or just plain white rice. Also had my choice of yet another side; I picked the crab Rangoon  (excellent!) but could have gone with an egg roll or pop among other options.     I ordered a coconut-lemon smoothie which was not only delicious it did wonders for my hangover:))  A really nice touch is the thermal bag it comes in to keep it cold-love that!! Wish more places did this.....it really is the little things!   I can't speak on dining in quite yet, but it's tasty food and a good value:)

12.description: Awesome place!  Kay gave me a mani-pedi, and she did a fantastic job!  She is very sweet and kind.  The other ladies that worked there seemed very nice as well.  It was great to see that all the ladies socialized with their customers as they worked on them.The salon very busy, which was great, considering it has been open only since August.  I'm very happy that it's in my neighborhood!  It's a friendly, neighborhood establishment that kind of reminded me of "Cheers;" the workers knew most of their customers by first name as they walked in.  I definitely plan on going back to Celine's Nail Salon.  I really enjoyed my experience there!

7.description: I have been searching for a nail salon that only accepts reservations and maybe a few walk-ins close to my neighborhood and found this salon through Yelp. I read the reviews and immediately called to book an appointment. When I arrived I was told I canceled my appointment however I did not. The front desk employee insisted that I called earlier that day and canceled. I again said no I did not. However, they were able to complete my manicure and pedicure and I was overly pleased with the results and also the feedback Celine provided me regarding my gel overlay. The salon was clean and welcoming (no loud conversations that should not occur in front of strangers like many nail shops) and calming music. I have definitely made this my permanent nail salon.

3.description: This place reminds me of one of my ex bfs. At first glance, it looks nice and clean with has a lot of room for potential but once you get down to it, you leave disappointed with the whole experience. Day before leaving on a trip, I had to cheat on my reg nail place and get my nails done during lunchtime. I checked yelp and Celine's had the highest ratings. I called about an hour before and they said I *must* have an appt. I scheduled one for that upcoming hour, even though it felt pointless. I arrive and the space is huge. There's rooms going into another room that has another room. A lot of pink walls and really intricate ceiling decor. The room I was taken to had a scaffold that I prayed didn't fall on me and looked like it was still undergoing construction. The girl that helped me was nice and not chatty which is perfect when I'm feeling antisocial. Lighting was pretty horrible in this room. I understand wanting to keep the electric bill down, but these girls rely mostly on the natural light which isn't smart when chicago gets bipolar and cloudy. They have tiny lamps for them to work with but when I picked my nail color, it was dim and I picked what looked like a light red. She began removing the current no-chip and placed my hands in weird warm gloves. She said it was to speed up the removal but it didn't do jack. The girl had to scrape my nails like you scrape baked grease off a pan. She began the routine mani steps and I noticed there was 0 water for my hands to be placed in. I hate hate hate these "dry" manis. She ends up yanking and cutting hard skin and the results are kinda ugly. Once she painted the nails and asked to put my hands in the UV thingy, the UV apparatus was crusty with previous dried up polish or god knows what. The whole time I prayed I wasn't catching an illness and washed my hands asap. I later walked into my office (with bright lights) and realized I had a freakin' peach colored mani. Peach! I was short on time and couldn't go back to correct it but I looked pretty odd for a couple weeks with peach nails against my crazy pale hands. The price was cheap but you get what you pay for. Like that ex bf, this place will not be seeing me again.

1.description: Manicure didn't last a day. Service is meh. They aren't the friendliest group. Not the nastiest but nothing in their service made me want to try again.

2.description: Me and my fiancée have come here twice and we must say the services are wonderful. They do an excellent job on pedicures and manicures plus they actually converse with you (unlike some places where they only speak to each other). My fiancée loves the way they do her nails and it really doesn't matter which nail tech. you get, they all do a wonderful job!Parking is plentiful so you don't have to worry about that. Just make sure you bring cash as they charge a little higher for the card fees and such. Also, bring something to read or listen to if you aren't in the mood to converse. Out of all the places we have been to, this one has to be our favorite and I will gladly give my money to Celine and her team for the work they do. Excellent job ladies! Keep up the good work!

9.description: Most excellent salon with extraordinary service. Celine and staff are awesome, professional and I highly recommend them! There is also a 5% discount when you pay with cash. Can't wait to plan my birthday celebration with them!

10.description: I wish I could give this place a - star rating only because its my hidden gem and want to keep it that way! I LOVE the service every time I come in, only once was I turned down but it was a Saturday and last minute.  They finally got in great new no-Chip colors and love that they don't' make you feel like you are bothering if you change your mind or like me can't seem to decide on your colors.:)Although it is a bit of a drive for me, I rather do the drive then to go to these upscale salons in the west loop area which I don't feel welcomed or have my nails barely covered in nail polish.

13.description: Its my first time in here everyone was really friendly, love fact that Celine and her girls seem to know most of her costumers by first name, also the girl who did my non-chip mani did a great job...Such a friendly place, you can be sure ill be back, also happy because is not that exepensive and is on my neiborhood.

16.description: Very high-end salon for the south side. They take appointments only, so they take their time doing your mani-pedi. The price is reasonable, $35.00. Considering booking the salon for my birthday party. They are helpful and really do an awesome job.

17.description: My appointment that I made based on the reviews above at Celine's was today. I agree that the salon is very nice. My services were to be a mani/pedi ...the service was nice, but I felt rushed. I must say that I did not feel very comfortable and frankly welcomed at this salon.    Just the feeling I had.

15.description: Great Spa chairs for the pedicures!! Gives a great massage. Very affordable and Celene and Joanne are both wonderful.

0.description: Celine's nail salon does amazing no-chip manicures!!  My last one lasted 3 weeks with no chips or peeling. They offer a huge variety of colors. They are appointment only so there is never a wait and if you pay cash you get a discount!

5.description: Best nail salon I've found on the south side for natural nails. The place was clean, they had tons of natural polish, and the service was great. You need an appointment, but I can deal with that. The fingernail polish has stayed on for a full day, which is a feat. It's my "in a pinch" place.

11.description: I visited Celine's on a Saturday. I was buzzed in and walked towards the nail polishes. I wasn't greeted until about 5 minutes later. I sat down and waited for my appointment time since I arrived a bit early.  I was called by the technician and sat down in the pedicure chair which was very comfortable. The water was white. So I figured it was some sort of soap for my feet. The pedicure was great. But I noticed that a few minutes later the water was clear. I figured it drained out the soap or something. The only thing I didn't enjoy about the pedicure was that the technician's hands were very cold. Also the lotion she put on my feet was freezing! Not very comforting. I guess this was because the salon was cold to begin with..... During my pedicure another technician started cleaning the station next to me. I noticed she sprayed Scrubbing Bubbles on the bowl and then she sprayed it on the pumice and the other utensil she used to smooth my feet!! She then scrubbed them both with a nail brush. I don't think this is the proper way to clean utensils at all! This lead me to believe that the white water was left over Scrubbing Bubbles.  Then I was moved to the other side of the salon for my manicure, which was even colder!!! The manicure was great but I couldn't enjoy it since it was so cold. And then add on the technicians cold hands and cold lotion. I actually had to ask the technician to stop for a minute while I put my jacket back on. I also found it rude that she was speaking to another technician across the room in their language. I would understand if they are next to each other but not across the room...... Once she finished I went back to the other side to dry my nails. I was acknowledged upon leaving. Which was nice.  But two days later my nails had already chipped. I don't think I'll be going back. I really wanted to like this place since it was so close to home.

8.description: I LOVE Celine's!  Celine herself was my nail girl for 10 plus years and I have followed her from place to place and now at her own shop.  Everyone in her shop is friendly and attentive.  I have always had a stellar experience here.  It's true you often need an appointment to get in, but I used to frequent a shop in which the owner NEVER turned ANYONE away.  What that really meant is the techs NEVER got any breaks.  12 hour days with no breaks, sometimes 6 or 7 days a week = slave labor.  "Appointments only" means the techs actually might get to take a lunch break, or run and get their kids from school in between appointments.  If I have trouble getting in to see someone, it's my own fault for waiting to get an appointment.Cheating on your nail girl is the same as cheating on your hairstylist.  You're never happy when you go someplace else.  That's why I always go to Celine's!

4.description: This place was AWFUL! My daughter, friend and myself went here for mani-pedi's. My daughter is only 6 however this isn't her first rodeo. She's been getting mani pedi's for years. They were so very nasty to her. They could have said they didn't take kids, I would have respected that. They were rude overall, especially to her and our nails looked like crap! Never again! I'll stick to Inail across the street where hey at least treat you human.

14.description: First time customer so I always walk in judging a new place :)First thing I noticed was how clean the store and the utensils used were. I have gone to many Northside and Southside nail salons and one thing that stood out at Celine's was how friendly everyone was and that everyone spoke English which made explaining what I wanted easier which was a plus. I would say it was one of the best No-Chip French Manicure I have had in a long time. But more importantly the nail artist did an amazing job with my nail design! She was so quick and precise it was literally nail art! I was very impressed by her and would go again.

6.description: Worst customer service and you think. They would have better hours since there are many option when choosing to get a mani pedi!!! Never again they should put signs saying what time they take their last client not what time they supposedly close.

3.description: Super slow check out. Even when the line is so big they will only have one cashier open. A lot of other workers just walking around doing nothing. This store has to do a better job of how can they use their workers more efficiently.

1.description: It wasn't in the plan to go there, but I was on the CTA 47 bus heading east.  I still have a gift card I received some time ago and thought I would make a brief stop to check it out.Well, it wasn't an exactly a "brief stop;" I did spend some quality time in the store browsing through merchandize that was pertinent to my interests.  I saw a cute tank, but it was slightly stained.  I had to walk away from it, unfortunately.  When a Burlington Coat Factory (I will affectionately refer as BCF from now on) has items that have been marked down, the percentage of markdown isn't going to be significant.  Normally, this is within a range of $1 to $10 deduction.  However, they do initially set their prices on a lower side.  An item will have a manufacturer's suggested retail price (MSRP) listed and the BCF price on a bold-print to illustrate how much you will save when you decide to purchase this item.  Sometimes, a MSRP is set unreasonably high.  Realistically, the qualities of most merchandize and their MSRP weren't always proportional.  If you're not picky and want something newer, not necessarily better, than what you will find in a thrift store, you may be a BCF client.  Otherwise, consider shopping at a discount retailer that is one (1) grade elevated, such as T.J. Maxx and Marshall's.  I did reluctantly purchase a beret since I had to use up the balance of my gift card.  Overall, this particular location serves the purposes for the residents in the nearby neighborhoods.  This strip mall where this BCF is located is called "the Yards Plaza," on corner of 47th. and Damen.  If you have a chance, check out the new BCF in the south loop, on Canal and Clinton.  That's a much better location.

2.description: This store location is just the worst. I blame management...This Burlington's coat selection is pitiful. Like seriously there were barely any decent looking coats on the racks (or floors) and fall is already here. Also there's  no size variety. I know the area is predominantly Hispanic but apparently management doesn't realize that thin women do come in every color and ethnicity. This place gets two stars for the exit being easy to locate to get the hell outta this dead end.

9.description: Abysmal selection, unless you like Baby Phat and late model Marc Echo. I like Burlington for a number of things: name brand perfume (my favorite is an Elizabeth Taylor version called Diamonds and Rubies that smells just divine on me), bras, semi-designer super clearance past season items. This location is filled with moronic customers and workers. It is hard to keep your lunch down when you hear someone screaming  "TyJuan, TyJuan I need my Link Card so I can go buy some Cheetos.' Just kills the shopping experience for me. Even worse than the selection is the checkout. The cashiers could not move any slower. R E A L L Y. Not only were there like 10 people in line but the employee was commenting on EVERY single item purchased. This is not a boutique, you are not taking the items home, the customer is not your girlfriend so save the 'OOOh gurl, that cute' for when you get off work.

10.description: The lines are always slow and the clothing selection is average,but I LOVE that I can always find a good pair of boots that fit my sexy calf's and shoes that fit my fiance's big arse feet! we usually have to order online for his shoes.

4.description: If I could put zero stars I would do it! Don't go to this particular location!! Save your teeth and probably your life.. A ghetto 300 pounds employee tried to hit me in that store, but she was held by 4 other employees, after a dispute over a security guard trying to hit another customer. I will never return to that store full of criminal employees acting as gang members with the customers while the manager cries over it and the store falls apart. That store is a chaos!! Security guy yelling to customers while threatening to punch them with a closed fist! No thanks, they will never ever have my businesses again. If you don't like to be treated as if the store employees are your boss, then don't go there! They get violent in that store/neighborhood. Go to another one or don't tell me that I didn't warn You!!!!!

6.description: ZERO stars. The aisles aren't kept clean, the selections are out of style, and the worst thing about this store are the employees. I spent 20 minutes in line while there were 4 cashiers. They're so slow! I understand interacting with customers but there is a difference between being friendly and LAZY which is just what every single one of those employees are; LAZY!!!! I do not recommend shopping here.

12.description: On a quest to find a pair of bridesmaid shoes (a lower end, quality version of a nicer version), I went to this Burlington Coat Factory. Thinking that it would be simple to find the shoes, we headed to the closest one and soon learned that the task at hand would be difficult. Walking in, it's pretty obvious how disorganized and nasty this store is. Everything seemed thrown around like people just threw aside it in a bid to find what they wanted. The shoe department was an even bigger expression of this throwing around of everything. There must have been a hundred shoes lying in the aisles in total disarray. I couldn't even remotely locate the pair that was prescribed as the "bridesmaid" shoe. After a few hopeless tours around the shoe department, another location became an option. I definitely wouldn't return to this store. It was depressing, dark, and organized.

5.description: I was just there yesterday. My shopping experience was "ehhh"....I already know off the bat this one is ghetto so expect to be surrounded by parents who can't control their kids and run around the aisles bumping into you. The woman's dressing room has broken doors and the floors dont look so clean. The checkout line was a 15 minute wait for 2 people in line...talk about slow cashiers!!  Even when the cashier was ringing up and bagging my items she was soooo S L O W...You must go here only if you have lots of patience and if absolutely necessary. I would also recommend to bring plenty of hand sanitizer to avoid getting some type of disease.

13.description: I always thought this place only carried coats. I guess I was mislead by the name. This place actually has it all -- clothing, electronics, housewares. It reminds me a lot of Marshalls and TJ Maxx. There's lots of last season designer items at low prices. Its a nice place to go to get some nice items at great deals.

11.description: I like their baby selection here, carters clothing, name brand bottles, and lots of major baby stuff. Good selection on strollers, high chairs etc. I do think that most of the items they carry here are last seasons, hence the lower prices. Today I bought a diaper bag for alot cheaper then I could find else were.  I do have to agree that checkout is really ridiculous, super, super slow. The huge line almost makes you wanna walk out empty handed.   Also big selection of shoes. Overall I think it is worth  to be patient, especially if on a budget.

8.description: This place has come a long way. They completely revamped the inside and its way nicer. Very good prices and I always love coming here. Good suits, clothes, coats and what not. I will continue coming here.

0.description: I recently ended up in this area by chance and decided to stop by this Burlington coat factory. I typically frequent the BCF on Canal street in Chicago. I thought this store had a pretty good selection of merchandise.Some of the things that I was not able to find at canal street were plentiful here. The store is not as orderly as the canal street store but still worth a good look. They have perhaps the best gift bag selection I have ever seen. Also, I could not believe how many hats, scarfs and gloves they still had. I also found quite a few items that had long sold out at the Canal location, like sweaters and jackets. I had one of the most phenomenal finds in their coat section.  I was able to buy a 450 dollar wool coat for 60 dollars. This coat was something that I had recently seen at Macy's and I could not believe my good fortune to find the same coat for much less. This place did not disappoint. I will be back

7.description: This particular Burlington reminds me of a thrift store. Never a good selection, and the items are all out of date, mixed up,  compared to other Burlington's (Lansing, 179th & Torrence) which I would give five stars compared to this location. The employees are straight up GHETTO, I had asked where I could find a particular style of pants (work pants), my response was a very sarcastic "WHAT" and then she claimed they were all over mixed in all the aisles, what a trashy store, with horrible customer service!

3.description: Never again. Funny smell to the place. Scary area. Food expensive for the area.  I hope I don't get food poisoning

1.description: Second time coming here I ordered a gyro this time gonna c how this turns out but they open till late like at mid night which is fine for meTrying the corn beef today gyro was on point n they used red onions never seen that

0.description: Nicky's is my go-to spot. I've never had an issue with service or the quality of my food. The tacos are so good! The lemonade is super sweet lol, I saw someone mentioned diluting it. It really sucks people come on here giving low ratings for the price of the food or for the area. Go to McDonald's if you want cheap fast food! And there's nothing scary about the area, I would dig deeper into that comment, but I know what she was referencing ha smh. Anyway, you want good, Chicagostyle food, this is your spot!

2.description: So.... Tonight I had spoiled chicken wings. It's my fault though for not getting out of the car when my son bought chicken in the car smelling weird.... I called & told the employee & all she had to say was "we haven't had any complaints" the chicken was NOT fresh, it was old. Why waste gas going all the way back? Sadly that was my last trip there. By the way, the "steak" tacos are philly cheese steak meat (yuck)

5.description: Nicky's driver came to the wrong house after midnight. He rang my doorbell smoking a cigarette. When I told him he had the wrong house, he wanted to argue. I told him he woke me and owed me an apology. Instead, he told me "fuck you" as he left. When I called Nicky's to complain, there was no manager and no one would take responsibility. I was told delivery was through a 3rd party. If I ever thought of eating there, I just changed my mind.

6.description: On Aug 15 2014 I places a order through grubhub. 8 Piece Chicken TendersSmall Fries$ 10.78Gyro PlateGyro Sauce$ 10.74Canned SodaSprite$ 1.98Slice of CakeLemon$ 3.49Slice of CakeDouble Chocolate$ 3.49Chili Cheese Fries$ 2.89 The chicken and the chili cheese fries were pretty good. The gyro plate never comes with enough for two. I received two sliced half tomatoes for two sandwiches.  And you are charged for adding extra sauce, when it should come with enough for two when ordering a plate. They didn't have the double chocolate cake and agreed to them sending me the next chocolate cake they had, both it and the slice of lemon cake where horrible. My ten year old son didn't like the cakes and that there speaks volumes.Delivery time is longer than any other place I have ever order from. When you go there, there is a sign that warns of the wait time, because everything is made to order.Frying frozen chicken tender and cutting the gyro meet shouldn't take any longer than other places that serve the exact same stuff.I was also charged $6 dollars for delivery, I'm not even a mile away.

7.description: Hands down my favorite fast food place in the entire city of Chicago! From the tacos, burritos, burgers, hoagies, gyros, Italian beef and my favorite of allllll time the Philly Mix, you just can't go wrong! They have desserts too and you have to try the butter cookies. I would avoid the flavored lemonade though because I had to dilute it several times. :-/ The food can do NO wrong !

8.description: The food quality is low, the cost is high, the delivery time is long, and only the worst of the worst do not realize that charging a customer after the order is placed for requesting a type of sauce in their order comments (GrubHub) will lose them that customer for life.  Ignorance abounds when a company's management doesn't understand their customer acquisition cost vs. the cost of a small cup of ranch dressing.  Will not be shocked to see this establishment out of business in a few months just like all the other sub-par short order delivery places in this city.  Another restaurant to put on the list of places to never order from again.

9.description: (8/8/2013) The food was delivered fast, (before scheduled time), and was good. We had beef and chicken tacos and the chicken burrito, (huge), which were excellent! The driver was courteous and friendly. I will patronize Nicky's again!

10.description: There was a fly in my burger wrapper. A dead, dried up fly. I threw away the rest of the food I ordered from there, around $25 worth. I've eaten from street carts around the world, but never have I ever encountered a fly in my food.

4.description: I didn't eat here but I got the steak hoagie special for my sister. She said it was terrible and from what I say it DID look gross. It was like a slab of "beef", like that patty used for the Mcrib... she said it was the worst thing she ever ate. My mom had the three piece wing special, she said it was alright. Three whole wings with fries and a piece of garlic bread for three dollars is a good deal so it's worth a try.

14.description: Great pawn shop!  Ed and Madeline were both very informative and kind.  My wife and I had a bad experience at another pawn shop and Ed wanted us to walk out with what we deserved.  They both explained how other pawn shops will try to screw you and not give full value for your items. Their pay down policy was also a sell for us. I highly recommend this pawn shop as you will be happy walking out!

3.description: I had a lot of old electronics sitting in the back of my car cause I'm too cheap to pay for a storage unit, but wasn't quite ready yet to part with my possessions.After reading my friends yelp review I decided to check this place out. I went Saturday morning and there wasn't a line, store was clean, and Rojelio (sp) quickly access my items. Now they just don't take anything. You have to have your items in working condition. I came Ill prepared, but he gave me tips on what to do to fix my items and he'd take them off my hands then. I'm going to search for the remote and cord for my tv monitor I know I have somewhere and take it back up there In the near future. Hopefully I can make a little cash. :)

1.description: Always on the hunt for a good deal, I like to come in and see what I can get on the cheap. I have purchased items as varied as a computer and a drill here!Be prepared to wait. The line is slow and they will take people paying on their loans first, regardless of your place in line. Once you finally get to talk to someone about the item you want they are friendly. However then you have to wait for them to retire the item, the power cord, the case, and answer the phone. There are endless interruptions, but such is the thrifting life. You finally buy what you want and get the longest receipt ever--CVS length! You get 7 days to return. Day 1 is the day of purchase and you can only return it to the place of purchase. You can not return to another location.  This never bothered me until I attempted to return something. I went when they opened and they unlocked the door 5 minutes late. The return receipt had no specific information. The return receipt just said REFUND with no code or other details. This became a problem when 7 days later I had not gotten my money back. I called to speak with the manger who was busy. I was then told because I couldn't give them any information, I would have to come in. Ugh.
