He was not too terrible to me, but he was dealing with an unruly and disgruntled potential customer on the phone and I heard him use a very demeaning tone and ultimately insult the customer's (likely sarcastic) interest in just ordering from some other restaurant. He said "Well, you pay for quality. They get all their stuff in frozen and ours is fresh." He then hung up and was obviously very huffy in attending to my grungy hipster lookin self. I am used to it because I look kind of poor, but this guy should be used to it with the location of his workplace. This isn't Lincoln Park! I don't really know how much ground he has to stand on defending the quality of this food either. It was alright. I had a piece of deep dish sausage pizza and a slice of regular crust pepperoni. The pepperoni was a little greasy, as was to be expected. The deep dish seemed on par with some of the more upscale eateries that I've paid much more than $1.50 a slice for. This place is just around the corner from my home so I will likely return with an updated review.

20.description: On a cold winter night. I wanted some pizza. I head toward Pizza nova in Canaryville.  Its a classic delivery pizza. Its not expensive, easy to find parking theres a liquor store across the street and you are in and out in a few minutes. The staff is nice. I like this place because that seems like all they make here is pizza so your guarenteed its hot and fresh.  It will sooth a pizza craving if you live on the south side.

19.description: Good for an emergencyThe staff are very friendly. The pizza is so cheap but it doesn't taste good. The chicken is interesting because it is boiled & baked..can be tasty, but the combo is very unhealthy..no vegetables with it. The gyro was tasty, but got me sick afterwards.  I would still go if there was nothing opened and was very hungry because the people are so nice there.

2.description: Decently priced food! Food taste great too, try the chili cheese fries are the way to go. They are good to the police too! There don't seem to be as many good places on the south side for pizza like there is on the North side but whenever works brings you here..Very polite and courteous. Will go here again on my next cheat day!

18.description: go to the "search for" data entry field in your yelp webpage header and enter "pizza" then go to "near" and enter "canaryville, chicago, il"click "search"3 pizza places pop up. 1 of which i am not even sure really exists. Pizza Nova, according to Google Maps and confirmed by me, is 0.1 miles from my front doorstep and takes 54 seconds to get there by car or 2 minutes to walk, slightly less if i go out the back door.... and i get there in about 1 minute if i jaywalk and cross the street regardless if the light is green and crosswalk clear... they'd even deliver it to me even though i haven't breached that level of lethargy just yet... jussssstttt yeeeettttttt....and their menu is loaded with items including bbq chicken and ribs, broasted chicken, seafood, pasta, italian and american sandwiches (apparently a huge difference here.... and a hot dog and gyro are considered an american sandwiches), burgers, PIZZA, PIZZA PUFFS, and gravy bread?and last but not least, their MILKSHAKES.... the infamous milkshakes i have mentioned in Yelp Talk... that my boy brings back from the yard... i like these milkshakes better than roses... nothing else says "baby i love you" better than theseso i cannot testify to very much of this menu aside from the pizza by the slice (thin and pan), burger, grilled chicken sandwich, fries, and the glorious MILKSHAKES (strawberry and chocolate WINNERS). YES - to the grilled chicken, pizza, and milkshakes... SURE - to the rest but dont come with elitist expectations. for the chicken and burger they made it fresh... it wasn't sitting around under a heater all day so we had to wait a few mins for it to be ready. there's not much competition here and the restaurants in my neighborhood are pretty scattered ways a part. there's either alotta home cooking or the PIZZA NOVA alternative. and i know neighbors that go here thrice a week. they'll miss church but not their pizza nova outings.but the deals are pretty hard to beat: this month about $20 for two 14"-inch thin crust pizzas one topping each and a 2-liter of pop... along with other eye-catching combo deals... 99% of the time we get a pizza by the slice for about $1.50... and a milkshake... only tip to remember is bring cash or you will have to by $10 worth of grub to charge...so yes if you are in this hood and starvin marvin stop here... i wouldnt go as far to say travel beyond your neck of the woods for it... but for whatever sparce reason you find to come to canaryville, come here and then bring me a milkshake... im only a yard away

13.description: I haven't ever been in here, but their delivery service is awesome.A few weeks ago, one of my students brought some of Pizza Nova's coupons to my attention: $13 for an extra large, one-topping pizza and a two-liter of pop, tax included.  I have 19 hungry high school students in my advisory who could totally get down with some $13 pizza and pop, so we decided to have a lunch time pizza party.For $65, we got five ENORMOUS pizzas and five two-liters of pop.  The restaurant was really great with our order (including my topping changes at least three times) and my specific pop requests.  They also let me pay in cash even though the order was big, which was nice.I was able to schedule delivery three hours in advance and our delivery guy was prompt.  He arrived, pizza and money were exchanged, and we were on our way to eating some pretty decent pizza.We all thought that $13 was too good to be true for pizza prices, but the pie wasn't that bad.  We all agreed the pizza was good and we've had much worse (especially at the school).  This pizza joint is great for groups and it's just what my students and I needed right before winter break.  We may make this a standing monthly party because we liked the pizza and the camaraderie so much.

4.description: Great price point, fast service and this very good food. The specials haven't done me wrong yet so I look forward to trying more of their menu.

24.description: When I first tried Pizza Nova I was shocked at how quickly they got a great pizza to my door. They always quote a 30-45 minute wait but they RARELY have me waiting past 30 minutes. I've gotten numerous pizzas with different toppings and they've all been excellent. This is a great neighborhood pizza joint with great pizza and great service. Give them a try, I think you'll enjoy them.

6.description: My boyfriend and I use to order pizza here but one day we order a pizza and went home. While we was eating I notice a slice  pizza my boyfriend was about to eat had a piece of blonde hair in it. It was hair throughout the  whole pizza. When we went to the restaurant the lady behind the counter said maybe it was my hair. First, my hair is black n not blonde they were extremely rude. We ask for a refund and they gave us our money back. They was just so rude about it. We will never ever go back there again.

15.description: Pizza nova did it again! Got a large icee for $1.99 and it wasn't even icy... Served it when it wasn't ready on a hot summer day. Haha! Call for disappointment...

7.description: Me and my friend ordered from this place and it was not as good as it smelled. The ribs was obviously not 1lbs it was a small amount. Secondly the fries was cold and nasty sauce was needed to fix this major mistake. Then the bread they provided us with was good but the hardest thing I have ever put my teeth into. I usually get a regular meal of pizza puff and mozzarella sticks ( I did have the mozzarella sticks and it was good ) but I advise you stick to the basics. Not seafood, soul food, nor the ribs.

8.description: Pizza was good, didn't like the rib tips and the broasted chicken didn't have a lot of meat on the bones

3.description: $7 for 3 slices and a large fries. Hot, tasty & ready right away. Can't complain!! People need to stop bitching about pizza that they're paying $1.50 a slice for, seriously.

14.description: I've had this menu in our drawer for over a year now, and on an evening when two other Pizzaria's were out of delivery range, I gave them a shot. I opted against the pizza because I hate wasting my money. I tried a few sandwiches for me and my family, a couple of Italian Beef's and a Gyros. According to my wife and son, the Italian beef's were good. The presentation was incredible, and the delivery was precise. As for my Gyros, on a scale from 1-10, it was a 7, but like another reviewer, I felt sick afterwards. Overall, not a bad choice, and great prices. Whoever answers the phones at that place is worthy of a well whooped a@$, maybe a little customer service training is in order.

3.description: Great neighborhood restaurant. Our server was good. The tamale appetizer and our salad was delicious. Fish tacos were w little dry:/  BYOB. Definitely looking forward to going back.

1.description: Excellent food. Great service.  We had the mussels for an appetizer and they were delicious!Pork chop for my main dish was cooked to perfection.  Definetly recommend this hidden gem.

2.description: Delicious! Excellent service.  The food is amazing! I meet the chef and he's delightful. I wish he'd add mofongo to the menu. I will be back and I'll bring friends. Until the liquor license come BYOB!

5.description: Excellent, we had the grilled shrimp with green mole and the ropa vieja with homemade corn tortillas, both dishes were delicious.  We'll definitely be back.

6.description: The food was above average but not stellar. The service was mediocre. The coffee was atrocious.

0.description: Do not let the location deter you!   This place is pretty awesome. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with smiling faces that were happy to have us.  From the small appetizer compliments of the house, the impeccable service, and the fact that it is byob, we will definitely be regulars here. Word of advice... Have the porkchop!  Stunningly beautiful cut of meat cooked beautifully.

4.description: They were so rude. The Manger said we couldn't substitute the disgusting food. The only good was the pop

0.description: this place has really decent airbrush work! i was highly impressed at the work, price & customer service! you can bring in your own shirt & its cheaper. cheap clothes, jewelry & tailoring on the lower level too!

Hey, why no reviews for Homer's?! I've only been here during the day for family gatherings (we like to party!), so I don't know what the crowd is like at night. Homer's is a pretty cool neighborhood dive bar. I always have a good time here and the drinks are cheap! I paid about $9 for THREE drinks (Miller Light, Stella and a Bloody Mary). That's how much you pay for one drink in my hood. The bartender even made the delicious Bloody from scratch! This place is out of the way for me, but my family is from the "Back-A-Da-Yaaaahds" so I will always be back to hang with them!

1.description: Slow and unorganized service. Food is not bad but also not good. Found a hair in my chilaquiles. I don't recommend this place; the one star is for the only good things they have-menudo and handmade tortillas.

0.description: Pronounced El Pat -ey-o.. Ok. the four stars is for the Enchiladas (yummy mole!) and the bistek Mexicana. The place looks like a run down truck stop and in need of new tables. My husband grew up a block away and loves the place, however I discovered it through a couple of Girlfriends.. One night he brought something home and I was like.. is that el patio (just from trying the beans..lol) and amazingly it was! We live in the burbs and make special trips there once and awhile.. Try their lunch specials. the range from $4.25 and up..including soup rice and beans!

1.description: If you live in Chicago and haven't had Harold's chicken you haven't lived life! Yo try it you won't be disappointed! I would recommend the white chicken with mild sauce finger licking good!

0.description: Sunday night, hungry as hell and in the mood for some chicken. Popeye's was closed and a came across Harold's online as an alternative. It's open until 12 a.m. and that gave me a nice window to go there in time. I didn't expect much from a joint that stays open late on a Sunday. I expected the food to be reheated and mediocre at best. I was so wrong. When I arrived I noticed my surroundings and quickly knew that I was in the hood. The joint was gated and there was a liquor store across the street. But I know better than to assume that because a joint is in the hood it equals bad food. There just might be some shady shit going on around you. I was greeted by a woman that was really nice and informed me that I had a 10-15min wait ahead of me because she had to cook the food. This made me happy. This implied the food was going to be prepared while I waited instead of being microwaved. The food: I ordered a 1/4 of white meat chicken, mild sauce, fries, slaw and bread. It had a nice smoky tabasco scent to it. The chicken was juicy, the sauce was slightly sweet and slightly had a kick to it. It was addicting. The sauce dripped on to the bread and fries and made what was just regular fries and regular white bread into something tasty. The slaw was little and great. This place is a rose in concrete.
Uh-a cliche rinkie dink diner. Every time I have been there there has been a bunch of old men there watchin the news, drinkin coffee, etc. The service there is nearly non-existent.

12.description: I've been going to the local Fairplay Foods ever since it opened. It used to be really ghetto and trashy but now they maintain it very well. The prices are pretty good and the customer service is excellent.

3.description: Wow, wished I knew to come here a lot earlier. I think the store is pretty clean and well stocked.They have lots of selections and good prices. They have some great weekly sales.It can seem a bit sketchy, but I think it's not bad at all.

1.description: I have driven past this place for a long time and never stopped in until I went shopping for a lady I work for and yeah I agree with one poster that they need to mop in the meat area since there's no reason for the stench. Also the sketchiness of the store is questionable because it seems right when the new month happens it never fails to see a gang of hoodrats and their family members tying up every department mainly the meat and deli with their orders to feed their idiot boyfriends and disrespectful army of children. Also they need to get in touch with the way other stores run by having self checkout lines to make things go faster. Also when they give out samples they need to have a trash can because the floor was littered with half eaten chicken tenders and I got sick of stepping on that crap and instead of using toothpicks they used pretzel sticks to serve the chicken tender samples. They do however have some good weekly sales. Their chicken nuggets are about the only thing I have taken a liking to since they taste better than McDonalds and does not taste like minced chicken but the actual tenderloin of the chicken. Park your car several spots away the hood idiots can't park for crap like they failed driver's ed so they're not up against your car and boxing it in.

2.description: Hit or miss with this place, but the last time was defo a miss. I brought some bagels. The Dutch brand o_O. Praise your Gods that I checked the bagel before eating it. Complete mold on the bottom of the bagels. Why keep moldy food on the shelves. Corporate greed at it's finest.I wish more grocery stories would take the time to mop and clean around the meat area. Walking into a store and the first thing you smell is the stench of meat is a turn off. I mean, yes meat has a smell, but not the smell of meat and blood caked up on the floor for days on end smell. Naw can't do it. On a side note I wish more people would use VINEGAR to clean with...moving along. Also, I do not trust buying my meat from here. It taste strange at times and sometimes it can be so tough. This is why I have to stop eating meat. "It taste strange. It was tough." WTF type of life did this animal live and I am eating it.The produce department is not good at all. The few times I got in to this place, I can never buy produce because it's so bad. Either it's moldy, soft or there are flies everywhere. I do like this grocery store, because some of their items are discounted and those Doreen's mini-pizza's, Gingerbread Men and Yoplait Cherry and Pomegranate yogurt. I can't find them anywhere else, so I am forced to to trek here from time to time, but just be careful when you are shopping at this place, you are liable to get a couple of vaccinations with some of their products.SIDENOTE: Just wanted to add that this place does has many cab drivers if needed. Professional and non. Ask for Mr. G if you need a ride.

9.description: i can't quite give Fairplay four stars but it has inched it's way up from one to three in the matter of month of frequenting there.i migrated from a uber dutch town that was DRY as well as closed on Sundays. there was a Fairplay the next town over that we would go to for booze and for the sin of grocery shopping on Sundays. i strongly remember it smelling like rotting fish back then.i was warned by my neighbors, by my landlord "DONT GO TO FAIRPLAY....unless you absolutely are in dire need of something fast". coming here my first time i parked in between two cars: one blaring gospel music, the other gangsta rap... i'm not kidding - i couldn't even hear my phone ring it was so loud! there is a personal COP at the entry/exit: badge, gun, serious face, that scans every one that comes in the store - you must check your bags in as well upon entry. lastly cop cars (not just security, but CHICAGO COPS) circle the parking lot almost every time i go. just parking here i feel like i've entered a place of sin.... but now i just remind myself when i arrive the lyric from the lesbian duo "indigo girls" that "every devil i meet is an angel in disguise".and i dunno if its a corporate strategy to lure us with the smell of baiting rotted fish, but this Back of the Yards location smells EXACTLY the same as i remember from a different location in my childhood. enough to deter me from shopping here for 6 months despite being less than a mile away from my home. i would drive ALLLLL the way to south loop Whole Foods, Trader Joes, or Dominicks for groceries - which at times felt like a chore, especially if i only needed a few basic items. then i was in dire need of something.... i went from shopping here for emergency items, then just for the basics, now for almost anything packaged or most produce that can be found at any other grocery store. see my list of do's and don'ts for deets...I DO BUY HERE: 1) fresh produce: you may need to inspect some bunches but most has been good in my experiences. you can't beat the produce pricing here. they have cactus (not even some of the big three grocery stores have cactus), fresh ginger root, big bags of spinach, cilantro bundles for 50 cents (we eat cilantro every other day), good avocados... among many choices especially for vegetables2) packaged meat: the same packaged ground turkey, but for less money. more pounds of chicken packaged for significantly less money - just have to cut a lil more fat off in preparation. i don't eat pork and rarely eat beef so i can't vouch for those as i haven't purchased them from here yet.3) anything canned, jarred, or bottled: this place is canned goods king - almost every aisle has something canned in it (i know where to go when i want to stock my fall-out shelter). brand fruit juices for sometimes half the price of other stores or off-brand for even better pricing. 4) milk, eggs, packaged cheese: cheese is good and priced well but no variety besides standard packages of shredded cheeses. eggs and milk abundant, though not much variety and you MUST check the expiration date to get the most out a purchase!5) baked goods, bread and tortillas: fresh and inexpensive. i buy a large coffee cake to bring for breakfast and coffee at the rents for as low as $2.50! eat bakery breads soon or freeze as i don't think they have preservatives.  6) guilty snacks: they have this off brand flavored microwave popcorn for a dollar or two. i cannot refrain from putting it in my basket. i even bring it to my friends house and it's devoured in seconds. they have many brand name snacks for less or way cheaper alternatives. candy is way inexpensive - i just walk straight passed the aisle to resist! every once in awhile you can get a gallon of ice cream for under $3 if you spend over 20 dollars - i haven't said no to this deal and i still have ice cream sitting in my fridge.I DON"T BUY HERE:1) SEAFOOD & FISH: it's smells like rotting fish here... i can't help but steer clear of it2) over-the-counter meats: absolutely no deli. i'm sure some of the meat is OK over-the-counter but i don't trust the handling and the packaged meats suffice.3) cigarettes: well they don't sell them... and i just recently quit so i guess it doesn't matter now! 4) yogurt: the selection is almost non-existent. i must drive all the way to south loop grocery stores, or even settle for the almost non-existent selection of Halsted Foods selection of yogurt down the street.

10.description: This store is great if you like meat, like me, and, like me, don't like paying a hefty price for it! Seriously how can one pass up four pounds of bone in chicken breasts for four dollars and fourteen cents? I think you'd have to be out of your gourd to do that. This store is huge and you can find a lot of random things that you can't find at a Jewel They also have very decent prices.

4.description: I don't like coming here because the quality of the food and fresh vegetables can be dubious sometimes. The neighborhood itself is sketchy but it's handy when you need a last minute ingredient!

6.description: I just want to apologize for shopping here and for bothering the cashiers with my groceries. Everytime I shop here I feel as if I'm a bother. The employees are extremely rude. A few days ago I got yelled at by Gertie the cashier because apparently I had a job to do... I thought I was a customer? Besides, who likes feeling like they're in the ghetto anyway.

0.description: I prefer this grocery store among many other local options. There is plenty of parking and shopping carts available . What I love the most about this store is the  produce section. There is an abundance amount of fresh produce to choose from. I can always find a good deal on the produce or mostly anything.

5.description: Been here countless times since I was a kid. They have a well-stocked place for foods. Their shopping carts have locks that refuses to leave the parking lot though. There's also a fresh deli and hot food section here. Not recommended to stop by during busy days (end of the month or beginning of the month) when most do the restocking. This place is similar to Cermak Produce (minus a lot of the ethnic foods, they carry a lot of cheap groceries though) and carries a lot of the items for cheap.

13.description: The sales at fairplay are awesome!!!! The gentlemen in the the meat department (butchers) are very nice and professional and aim to please their customers, and the prices are reasonable

11.description: I recently moved to the area and I was on the hunt for finding a good neighborhood store. Fairplay is a good place to go for great deals.  You can find everything and anything in this store.  The meat is reasonably priced and specials on cereal and produce are competitive. Their bakery offers a great selection of cakes and pies.  There is even a "Day Old" clearance rack that offer fresh rye bread loaves for 50 cents!  I was in heaven! The produce is fresh and I see Whites, Blacks, Hispanics and Asians in this store.  That says a lot about the place because it offers something for EVERYONE!  The meat is good quality and every week there is a new sale.  Check it out!!

8.description: This supermarket is like a combination of all good things - the brand variety of Jewel/Dominick's combined with the bargains of ALDI, complete with a butcher, bakery, hot foods, deli counter and fishmonger.People from all walks of life can be found in the store, but it's located in Back of the Yards next to a dollar store and it's open all night on the last day of every month.Most of their weekly bargains (the ones noted in their weekly ads) can be found huddled together at the store entrance, but also in the regular aisles.  If you're in there and you're hunting for the milk, it's hidden in the corner in a little niche with some soda machines.  Just head all the way to the right as soon as you get in.You'll also probably find cuts of meat and pieces of animals that you've never seen before and might be shocked to know that people actually buy.  I now know where to look if I wake up one morning with a craving for pig's feet, turkey necks or hog jowls.  Or need a 40-pound box o' chicken parts.  Cuz they sell 'em there!Other awesome hidden spots - the aisle full of things you wouldn't believe could cost a dollar.  Take special note of the jars of preserved fruits and various boxed and canned foods - all costing $1 apiece.  Also, this is the corporate location and posibly the biggest, so they've got room to include different flavors of certain foods.  I never knew some of my favorite brands of barbecue sauce had so many different flavors!  And the chips as well!A word of advice: they try to check all bags/backpacks when you come in.  The first time I shopped here, I was almost hunted down by this guy because I had a backpack with me.  It all seemed fine, because I watched him clip a clothespin on my backpack and gave me the matching one, but at the end of my shopping trip - the guy was nowhere to be found.  If this happens to you, just go to the checkout on the far right that's also a counter - your bags are stored there and if the bag-check guy has disappeared (which he has over 70% of the time I've been there), the person working that checkout will get you your bag back.All in all, it's rare that I give a location a 5-star rating, but the fact that you can get there on the #47, #8 or #44 bus (the last of which swings right by my apartment) make this one of the easiest grocery chain stores for me to get to, and one of the cheapest I've ever been to as well!

14.description: This is a long standing grocery store chain in Chicago. Fairplay has good produce, great meats and low prices. This store is located in the Back of the Yards "hood" area, but I have never had problems here. Black, whites and hispanics shop here. Its not upscale like some stores, but your dollar lasts longer here than at other stores. I like Fairplay!

7.description: My mother insists on shopping here. Just a question...... Why are the cashiers here always so angry with my groceries??

28.description: ah, here we are. this "restaurant" has only one reason to exist, and that is the Al Pastor tacos. really, with a bit of imagination YOU can make most of the stuff on their menu. and make it better. but the al pastor, ( marinaded pork ) tacos are head and shoulder the best in this state. i will stand behind that statement. unfortunately, i can't say the same about the rest of the menu. only for the hardcore pork enthusiast

1.description: This place is the greatest taco joint in all of Chicago! The taco al pastor is very delicious and I can't get enough of it. I've been coming to atotonilco for 14 years and I am always satisfied after eating one of those incredible tacos with a nice strawberry milkshake. Staff are nice people and do an exceptional job always. Could use a nice clean up but taking your food to go is always an option.

9.description: Sauced carrot and rice water is good. The taco and sandwich is too ordinary, it's ok, not wow. The grill pork taco is $2.50, the beef sandwich is $5, the small rice water is $1.5.

23.description: Tortas are good. Love em.Milkshakes are the best (strawberry)No doubt. Maybe cause they put in a whole mess of sugar but if you order a large drink to go they'll give it in a big ass cup. It's about 4 bucks for a large. a torta is about 4 something, tacos are about 2 bucks or a lil more. Its open all the time. I actually don't know what time the close or open cause i see them open always.

5.description: I've been to Atotonilco in the past, a different location however.The food was standard, there wasn't anything special about it.  My main gripe, and the reason for the low rating, is because of how dirty the place was.  The bathroom was disgusting,  there was no soap or paper towels.  There were dirty dishes piled up in view of the dining area.Our server was extremely nice and attentive & I saw that the entire staff was the same way - the cooks, cashier, even the random man in the back that was sweeping away.  All in all, if they get their act together, I'll return.

25.description: ayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy been coming here since i was a lil girl! I think the tacos de pollo are my favorite and one of the best lil places to get pollo or carne asada for sure ! tortas are also very good. Make sure to get a licuado de platano o fresa aka a banana or strawberry milkshake to go along with your torta or tacos. The green sauce is also amazing :) def recommend this joint if u are a taco fan

12.description: I have been going to this place since I was a child and this is the only taco place that never disappoints! The tacos are always stuffed with perfectly seasoned meat and the tortillas slighty have a delicious crisp. I always get a chocomilk liquado! Mmmmm for the people talking about no rice and beans its a taco joint not a restaurant, the menus are on the wall!!  A lot of  taco places don't serve rice and beans. Although i think their sister one on 26th does.  No atm, no problem, the meal is like 5 bucks, and they have an atm. The atm is in spanish ? Of course,  when almost every single person in the mexican meighborhood speaks spanish as a first language, i wonder if you will have the same complaint in Mexico. Always a tummy pleaser and guaranteed pocket pleaser!  If your looking for a great taco cooked in just a few minutes and don't mind paying cash then I'm sure this is it!

21.description: This restaurant is a taqueria, so there is only tacos and tortas. No other type of dishes. The steak tacos are my favorite and arguably in a league of their own, but their Al Pastor tacos are simply amazing. If you like tacos and aren't afraid of pork its definitely a must. Although the restaurant itself can use some air ventilation, sometimes smells kind of like mop water, the amazing food makes up for it all. This is my favorite taqueria and has been for about 15 years.

16.description: The restaurant is pretty clean. They were quick with service in the behining but to get our waiters attention in the end was impossible as he was always talking to the staff.The meat is extremely tender and flavorful with the tacos and they keep their menu simple. The only problem is that their tacos kept ripping apart because they are so moist and have so much meat. Otherwise the restaurant is  pretty good.

17.description: My girlfriend loves this place since she's been coming here since she was young. I like it, but don't love it.The place is kept very clean and I've never sat  at a dirty table while eating. The menu compromises of just tacos and tortas. They due offer a good selection of different variants though. Their al pastor and carne asada are very good. The tacos themselves are decently sized and are a bit expensive. They cost about $2.25 for each individual taco, but it's worth it in my opinion.This place is a lot better than most taquerias I've been too and the service is attentive, since they want a decent tip.I'd recommend this place to anyone who loves tacos.

10.description: Good Authentic Taco Joint in "Back of Yards" Hood! They bring fresh "Carrots & Peppers" to the table when you sit down.  Just had tacos but the Al Pastor was phenomenal as well as the Carne Asada!  Saw some Torta's going to other tables and they looked amazing!  Will def be back to try some of the other offerings/ service was good as well!  gtfjd

11.description: I will never eat here again. The food was horrible, I ordered torta de milanesa and the meat was re cooked. Seriously? The meat was so hard I had to throw the torta away, which was very hard for me to do because I usually eat everything in my plate and then some.

26.description: David and I drove around Back of the Yards looking for a Mexican joint that would call to him. (As a vegetarian, I let him choose Mexican restaurants; in Mexican restaurants, I usually end up eating eggs (can't give 'em up no matter how hard I try) or, if I'm of a mood not to care that I'm being a pain in the ass, some special request, all vegetable fajita dish).  So we ended up here. Our waiter seemed genuinely happy that we really liked the carrot-pepper-cauliflower mix that he brought to us before our orders came out. He brought us seconds on the carrots after we gobbled them all down. (We were starved because it took David awhile to choose from the endless supply of taquerias and other restaurants in the area.) The tortas were fine, particularly for $4, but those carrots were really the highlight, along with the truly wonderful service. Oh, and they serve Diet Rite, which I kinda like. We ate a sugar cookie from La Baguette on the walk back to the car. Not a bad way to spend a Friday evening.

27.description: I come here for the tortas de lengua and the agua de pina. The lengua or beef tongue is soo incredibly tender that it makes you forget what part of the cow it comes from. I like to order the torta (or sandwich) with avocado. The "aquas" are great too. It's a great alternative to a milk shake. Aguas just has the fruit and sweetened water, but they also offer milkshakes. They go down nicely with the great tacos and tortas. The service is usually very prompt.  The place isn't very fancy at all but the food is so good and cheap. It's always worth traveling all the way from the Northside.They have several locations but this one is a block over from tortilleria of the same name, where the tortillas are made that go out to their restaurants and grocery stores all over the city.  Their tortillas are my favorite. They have the freshest flavor and are minimally processed. If you read the ingredients on the wax paper wrapper, you see that they have only a few all natural ingredients.  Also if you feel adventurous enough to make your own tamales, you can find ground fresh masa.

0.description: My coworkers treated me to the milanesa torta and an horchata for my birthday. I love this place. Great staff, awesome food and around the corner from my job.

20.description: Pretty good food for an alright price.

19.description: I live nearby and this is definitely my go to place for quick food, whether it is lunch time or 4am :)The zanahorias (spicy pickled carrots) are totally addictive, the salsa is flavorful and the liquado de fresa (strawberry smoothie) is amazing.  All the tacos and tortas are good, though the menu has pretty much exactly the same options as anywhere else.  The aguas are all delicious, jamica (hibiscus tea) is my favorite on a hot day.

2.description: Average at best. The torta I had had a few pieces of carne asada. Totally unacceptable. It was bland. Not the standard quality from this establishment. The meat quality is not what it used to be and there's a better option down the street that's amazing.

18.description: Tortas are good. Love em.Milkshakes are the best (strawberry)No doubt. Maybe cause they put in a whole mess of sugar but if you order a large drink to go they'll give it in a big ass cup. It's about 4 bucks for a large. a torta is about 4 something, tacos are about 2 bucks or a lil more. Its open all the time. I actually don't know what time the close or open cause i see them open always.

13.description: i have been eating at 'tonocs for over 20 years.this is not somewhere to go if you're looking for a fine dining experience.  this is the place to go for fresh hot food, priced reasonably.  i am a fan of their carne asada tacos - fat and gristle free!!  love it.  i can't count the number of places i've gone to in the city where i've gotten less than stellar carne.  i am hardly a meat whore, so when i do order it i expect it to be delicious and gristle free!i always get mine loaded w/ onions and lettuce, w/ crema on the side.  their crema is the best.  i have never had a bad experience w/ it.and don't forget the carrots - fresh, crunchy, yum!  i don't know if the jicama is a new thing for them, or it was just that long since i've gone, but they do this right.back in the late 80's this was the place to go after clubbing.  i imagine it's still the place to be.oh, and don't forget the horchata!  it's FRESH.  fresh made.  not a mix!  love it!

4.description: We were passing by and decided to stop in and eat. I've heard so much about their al pastor.I opted for two al pastor tacos and a strawberry banana shake. I have to say I was not impressed. It was different, but I've definitely had better. The shake was fine.My guy got the steak torta and said he's had better.My guy said the one on 26th is better. Will have to give that one a try. The place was clean and they have camera monitors for the parking lot.

24.description: Atotonilco is by far one of the best fast food Mexican food joints in Chicago. Their menu is pretty simple, tacos and tortas, no gimmicky "super nachos" junk that other places offer for their 3am drunk clientele.You HAVE to have the al pastor tacos, hands down the best al pastor in Chicago. While you're at it, have a torta, hell, have 2 al pastor tacos and a steak torta with easy sour cream. (My favorite)

6.description: I live on the north side of chicago and have traveled to the hood to eat at this place. My boyfriend and I come here for the tacos. They're just sooooo good and it's made fresh. The servers and staff seem nice. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because the restaurant can be a bit dirty. I don't mind "hole in the wall" restaurants but you still have to keep your business clean. And they could use new chairs and upholstery. But if you do venture out to this place, the tacos are soooo delicious :)

22.description: As you get out of your car in their free parking lot, you are already swept up in the aroma coming from the restaurant and you begin to drool.  We were introduced to this place by our Mexican friends (born and raised there)  several years ago and this has become our regular Mexican restaurant.  I've only had tacos but I see that all the Mexicans mostly get the sandwiches (tortas).  Milkshakes are very good like the other reviewers said (papaya is my favorite, when in season).  We order tacos one or two at a time so we can eat them whilte really hot.  The waiters don't seem to mind.  You do get them in little plastic baskets but the food makes you look pass that.  The tacos are overfilling with filling.  Their al pastor taco (with the red sauce) rivals the one made in the Mexico.  Eat them Mexican style with only onion and cilantro with some lime (not with lettuce and tomato).  I typically get the lengua, al pastor, or chicken taco.  The barbacoa and steak tacos are only so-so.  Horchata is ok there, a bit too sweet.  Pickled veggies are on the table for free.  Yes, the tables and floors can be cleaner but again, due to the food, we can look pass that.

15.description: I've officially found my new taco shop on the Southside. I got a taco al pastor and a taco barbacoa (which was spicy!) at a reasonable price. They were quick, food was still hot when I got back to the office, and the portions were healthy. I'll have to try the fresh fruit bar next. The free lot on the side of the building helped me get in and out. It's a humble location, but the food is definitely worth it.

7.description: I came here once and won't be coming back. I got a steak torta with a side of rice and beans...or so I thought. I got home and there was only a torta in the bag, and while it was a nice size, it was flavorless. I checked my receipt to make sure I was charged correctly, and I was only charged for the torta luckily. I called and asked about rice and beans and apparently they don't have any? Huh? Aren't you a Mexican restaurant? Okay....I guess. I would've thought they would have told me that when I requested it and proceeded to pay. Speaking of paying this is a cash only place from what I recall. The ATM they have is only in Spanish so luckily I'm half Hispanic and know enough Spanish to make things work.Overall, it was just too mediocre for me to want to give it another go. I'll spend my money somewhere else.

8.description: Best spot when drunk or with big groups.when I was younger my parents brought me here, since we moved the neighbor miss this spot.

3.description: Not bad, but wouldn't recommend it. Food takes long to arrive and is plain. Meat is dry and no flavor!

14.description: Best. Steak. Tacos. Pickled carrots pair nicely with steak tacos with onion/cilantro/lime... Fast and friendly service. You can see them make your food at their open grill right at front. Strawberry shakes are awesome. Definitely one of my favorite local Mexican spots. Absolutely a regular favorite!!

1.description: Amazing quality, totally recommend this place.very pleasant to work with and will keep coming back for more.

0.description: Loved this place! Best embroidery ever. Great customer service, very quick with all my orders, and their prices are great.

Couldn't be more impressed with Morgan's work from Artisan & Modern Day!  I randomly came across her furniture when I was browsing the web and I only wish I would have found her sooner.  I had a really hard time trying to find a media console/bookshelf that would be suitable in our living room with a toddler, so I resorted to something being custom made.  Her work is high quality and stands above even what a Pottery Barn would offer.  It could easily be mistaken for Restoration Hardware furniture, but at a fraction of the cost.  She is so easy to work with and has the ability to envision and create exactly what you have in mind.  I'll definitely be using this shop in the future and would highly recommend to anyone and all.  Thanks again!

1.description: Stay away from this fecking place.  I had to wait in line for 20 minutes. The ONLY reason I stayed in line was because my nephew had his heart set on a Kids Meal.  I get up and give the chick my order.  I told her I wanted a veggie burger, made like a whopper.  Why in the hell did I have a friggin Whopper on my tray when my order was called? I wanted to ask, "Are you friggin retarded?"  Did you just listen to only every third word out of my mouth?  People are slow..

0.description: I've never had to wait. Ever. I routinely hit this Burger King for coffee either in the afternoon or evening, and I've never had to wait more than a minute or two to be out the other end of the drive through. That's with half a dozen others waiting too! I sometimes get food, but no matter, I'm usually out in the same amount of time. Much better than other fast food joints that have two lanes, and can't seem to handle half of the traffic that this place does. The staff has ALWAYS been friendly and courteous.  The parking lot is a little chewed up, maybe it's time for a new one.  I haven't been inside, so I can only talk about the drive thru. But as far as their purpose --being a fast food joint-- they nail it.  They get me food, fast, correct, and courteously. End of review.

3.description: This is my mother's favorite place to eat. They have good coffee with cinnamon, great chilaquilles, great quesadillas and a few more delicious items.

1.description: Las Esperanzas is one of those great corner neighborhood restaurants.  You walk in and seat yourself or go up to the counter if you want to place your order for take out.  When I went for lunch today, I sat down and was immediately greeted by my waitress who brought me a menu.  After placing my order, she brought me chips with two salsas and a cup of soup that came with my meal.  I was not in the mood for soup considering it was almost 90 degrees outside, but it was ok-it had macaroni, celery and potatoes.  A few minutes later however, the steaming skillet of fajitas arrived.  The shrimp and veggies were delicious- hot, fresh, well-seasoned; they also brought me the beans, rice and salad that went along with it.  I was thoroughly stuffed afterwards and spent around $12 for my meal, which was a great price.  I found it to be a great choice for Mexican food with friendly service.

2.description: I'd like to say this place is what the kids call, "flame!" Came to work super sick, coughing all over the place and was in need of some soup. Their caldo de res was as delicious as my mothers. Makes me just want to hug the lovely ladies working the counter. Did I mention they're sweethearts?? Their tacos!!!! Oh, dear lord... Mega-deliciousness, in need of a bit of salt but, still delicious. All in all, the soup helped me sweat out my cold while hitting the spot. :)

5.description: Well, another one bites the dust. I have been going here since it opened a few years ago. the service was as good as it can get for a mexican joint in the 47th st. The other night was by far the worst service I have received. To all severs in the back of the yards area, check on your customers. Don't bring them food that is greasy and not bring them any refills. By the way the torta cubana was very very greasy. I couldn't eat, and I'm in the service and have eaten some foul stuff before but that took the cake, easy. Service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

0.description: YUM YUM YUM.  I have been meaning to write about this place. They are FFFFaLLLLLLaAAAAMMMMEEE!!!! The food is Yum-A-Rific! The place is a nice size, kind of dark but has art on the walls.  (They have a ton of plants by the front window, which i am not a big fan of).  I have ordered everything here, seafood platter (tri-color was ok), tacos, burritos, huaraches, quesadillas, caldos. All were mmm-good. They also delivered and hope they continue to do so.I know they are under construction now, but can not wait for them to open those doors up again to go have some deliciousness.Order anything and you will not be disappointed at all. BYOB

4.description: So, did I mention that i love tacos?This place was pleasantly surprising.  The pictures of the Tortas they have in the windows looked pretty good, but I knew what I was going to order.  I wanted 3 big fat tacos, some beans and some rice.  And that's almost what I got.  Instead I got 2 really big fat tacos and some beans and rice and a mandarin Jarritos.  Totally hit the spot, the chips and salsa were pretty good, the service was pretty nice too.  However, they didn't take visa...frownies.All in all, great place for lunch and probably dinner too.  We got complimentary chicken soup (pretty awesome too) and I left very satisfied.  I love finding places like these and bonus points for awesome sopas.yeh buddy!

1.description: The location is good, but parking is challenging if you drive in.  Public transportation is easy. My instructor was Forrest.  Forrest is a very talented guitar player.    Lessons are set at 30 minutes exactly.  Students are back to back.  The timing is tight.  Lessons have to start without a lot of chit-chat to get the most out of them.   The facility is clean, but it is a shared multi-tenant office space.  They provide a guitar to use.  This is a nice benefit.  It would be a hassle to carry one in and out.  When I was there they did not use amps.  I assume this is because they are in an office environment and can't make too much noise.  Their cancelation policy is fairly strict.  Students have to give a 2 week notice to cancel.

9.description: I learned about Guitar Chicago through Groupon. Before I provide my review I will say that I attended (electric) guitar lessons for 6 months with Forrest. There is no doubt that Forrest is a phenomenal guitarist. Very inspiring and encouraging. His guitar abilities are one of the best I have seen in person. Great guy and very personable and down to earth. I enjoyed all our conversations. The reason for the 3 stars is I struggled a bit with the structure and learning plan (there wasn't any). I consider myself an "advanced" amateur. I've been playing guitar for ten years and piano for twenty. So it is hard to convey how much I know about music. Nevertheless, it was hard coming up with a structure and learning plan that fit my level. In retrospect, I would like to have sat down and drafted this so we didn't waste class time (read: $$) discussing this. Similarly, we spent some time transcribing songs - strongly recommend against this. If you can, buy the sheet music or ask them to see if they have it. I was satisfied with what I got out of the lessons and I would recommend it for guys and girls who are starting with instruments. If you are a seasoned player who wants to go back to fundamentals I would strongly suggest you create the study plan and topics you'd like to cover.

12.description: My boyfriend, amazing guitar player though he is, cannot teach. Thus, I needed to find a guitar teacher on my own. Enter Groupon, and the beginning of my lessons at Guitar Chicago. I was very nervous the first lesson- AP Music Theory was a long time ago, and I didn't even know what string was what note. I was thrilled to meet Jim, and throughout my allotted lessons, he helped me get a basic (and rapidly improving) knowledge of the guitar with patience, humor, and repetition. He makes you want to pick up the guitar and practice as soon as you leave. Some of the things to love about Guitar Chicago: 1) Location: Right off the brown or red line, and just a quick elevator ride up. 2) Guitars and picks provided, which makes commuting very easy, and you get to brag that you played some cool guitars. 3) Pay online!4) You can do classes as well as lessons, AND they have just started to do piano as well. 5) Schedule: I have a crazy work schedule, and Jim is always understanding with needing to move or cancel lessons based on that. It's a huge benefit for professionals. I've continued past my Groupon and am now taking lessons twice a month with Jim, in the hopes that I will soon master the dreaded F chord and many more endeavors to follow. Sign up as soon as you can and get playing!

21.description: One of my favorite things about Jim is how he tailors his lessons according to your taste. When i mentioned that i'd like to learn the "why" behind a lot of what we're doing, he started incorporating music theory in the bass lessons. He's also pretty patient and will take you through the steps until you've reached the solution yourself, which is great for learning.And for those of us who work in the loop and don't want to lug guitars/basses around, you can just use the ones he has! Including a totally sweet hofner bass that i hate to say i have more fun playing on than mine!Once i can do victor wooten-esque bass solos, i'll give him a 6th star ...

16.description: I've been taking lessons with James for over a year now. When I started taking lessons, I was dismal. My main goal when I started private lessons was to improve my soloing ability. I had always heard that the only way to really learn how to solo is to take private lessons.Taking lessons with James has improved my musical ability in all areas. I am much better versed in music theory, my rhythm playing has improved, and my soloing has improved greatly. My other musician friends have noticed a huge improvement in my ability since starting lessons.James has taught me a number of different styles and techniques. He always has good answers for my questions, and is always able to help me out when I am struggling with something. He teaches you the right way to do things, so you don't end up treading water.If you are considering taking guitar lessons in the loop or anywhere else, give Guitar Chicago a look.

17.description: One of my favorite things about Jim is how he tailors his lessons according to your taste. When i mentioned that i'd like to learn the "why" behind a lot of what we're doing, he started incorporating music theory in the bass lessons. He's also pretty patient and will take you through the steps until you've reached the solution yourself, which is great for learning.And for those of us who work in the loop and don't want to lug guitars/basses around, you can just use the ones he has! Including a totally sweet hofner bass that i hate to say i have more fun playing on than mine!Once i can do victor wooten-esque bass solos, i'll give him a 6th star ...

10.description: I have been involved with music for a long time, but after college got out of the scene.  I decided to take piano lessons to get back into it.  I could not have picked a better place or teacher than I have now.  Brett is awesome.  He is attentive to the type of music I want to play and alters his lesson plan to help me meet my goals.  He has even helped me with the purchase of a new keyboard.  Lessons are fun, interesting, and helpful.  I have only been taking lessons for a little more than a month, but I already see improvement.  I am really enjoying this, and would recommend Guitar Chicago to anyone who wants to take music lessons!

5.description: I started taking piano lessons with Scott about a year and 1/2 ago. He's a great teacher! Definitely consider Guitar Chicago if you want to pursue learning to play an instrument. Its location also makes lessons super convenient for downtown professionals.

11.description: About a year ago, my girlfriend bought me a coupon for guitar lessons at Guitar Chicago as a very thoughtful birthday gift.  Being that I was my mid-20s and having a brother who is a very accomplished Spanish/Classical guitar player, I felt a bit intimidated taking lessons.  From the first moment I met Jim, my whole attitude towards guitar lessons were changed.  Jim's program is unlike a traditional lesson, being that its not a traditional step by step approach.  Jim focuses on the individual and their respective goals.  He does all in his power to ensure that the lessons are fun, but also that they have real educational value.  I have to say that after the coupon ran out, I went back for many more lessons and have never regretted it!  Guitar Chicago is a different kind of learning experience and has changed the way I play guitar and understand music as a whole.  Jim and his team are a wealth of musical knowledge truly understand that the instructor must establish a level of trust with the student in order to be successful. It is very clear that the Guitar Chicago staff loves what they do and works to see that every lesson is a solid progression.  In the short amount of time I spent with Jim, I learned a lot and built up more confidence in my abilities.  I would HIGHLY recommend Guitar Chicago to anyone looking learn guitar in a very respectful and inviting environment.

22.description: I've been taking lessons with James for over a year now. When I started taking lessons, I was dismal. My main goal when I started private lessons was to improve my soloing ability. I had always heard that the only way to really learn how to solo is to take private lessons.Taking lessons with James has improved my musical ability in all areas. I am much better versed in music theory, my rhythm playing has improved, and my soloing has improved greatly. My other musician friends have noticed a huge improvement in my ability since starting lessons.James has taught me a number of different styles and techniques. He always has good answers for my questions, and is always able to help me out when I am struggling with something. He teaches you the right way to do things, so you don't end up treading water.If you are considering taking guitar lessons in the loop or anywhere else, give Guitar Chicago a look.

0.description: I had an old guitar sitting in my basement for 10 years and always told myself I was going to learn to play.  I finally decided it was time in January 2015, found guitar Chicago on Google, and signed up for a free one time lesson.  I've been working with Dan now since then, and I'd recommend him if anyone asked about guitar lessons.  I was a complete beginner, knowing absolutely nothing, but he's been patient and encouraging. There also has been some times where my schedule has been all over the place, but he's been super accommodating and we've always made it work out.  I'm very happy I found this place, and if you are thinking about taking lessons, I'd highly recommend it.

20.description: If you're a spiteful jerk like I am, you'll instantly want to hate Jim for building this guitar empire and having what seems to be the coolest job in the whole world while the rest of us trudge through employee grievances (or pivot tables, or TPS reports, or whatever the flavor of your own personal work hell) on a day to day basis.  But I admit, he's pretty cool.  I started taking bass lessons about a year and a half ago.  I'm one of those people who gets mad at the world if I'm not really good at something really fast and I also am prone to shooting myself in the foot long term if it means short term gratification.  (Example:if playing with a pick is hard to do, I won't do it. Even if I know it will make me ten times faster and better down the road.  I don't want to do it NOW.) Compound this with my needing to know WHY I'm doing something before I can do it and I've been told by others that I'm a challenge to teach. Not so for Jim- he has a wealth of patience with me (probably because he's also taught kids)!  In fact, I liked him so much that I referred my husband and he has been taking lessons for about a year now as well.  I was brand spanking new to the bass while my husband has been playing guitar for 15 years... Jim adapts to each of us perfectly which I think speaks volumes for his versatility whether you are a brand new student and have always wanted to try this or you are somebody experienced and feel like you hit a wall, or want to learn theory.  Or just need that extra razzle dazzle.  This place has the perfect set up.  Downtown at Michigan and Randolph, it's in a regular office building and you play guitar (or bass) into a mixer with headphones so as not to disturb the neighbors.  They have a bunch of guitars there (I'm quite fond of the Hofner bass myself- so keep your greasy mitts off it) so if you work downtown all you have to do is trot over there for 1/2 an hour a week and you're on your way to rockstardom.  I'm kicking myself that I didn't do this years ago- I could have been a Beatle by now dammit.  FYI there are two other guys that work there so you might get one of them.  Jason subbed once for Jim and was very knowledgeable- I liked him a lot. The other guy I've never met.  However, Jim assures me he hand picked these fellows out of a very large crop of applicants (think: best of the best; the shiniest apples on the tree) so I'd say you're pretty safe no matter what.

19.description: Love this place. After studying the guitar for years, I started taking private lessons at Guitar Chicago. I've learned more in the last year, than I have in the last five. I was intimidated by private lessons, but it's a laid back atmosphere. Jim does a great job of  helping you work on your goals, while pulling in other lessons that will be beneficial. Definitely check it out!

2.description: Excellent instruction integrates solid and necessary - but not overwhelming - music theory with functional skill development. If you are ready to do the work they are ready to work with you.

18.description: I took guitar lessons with Jim (the owner) at Guitar Chicago for about 6 months.  I had a good time and learned a lot, unfortunately I had to quit because of time constraints.  However, I think Guitar Chicago is a solid place for anyone to take lessons.  It's located in the heart of the loop and convenient to most businesses downtown.  They have classes during the day and in the evening so it's easy to take lessons on a lunch break or after work.  They also provide guitars if you don't have your own or don't want to lug one around during the day.Jim is a very knowledgeable instructor who can teach and show you about anything you want to know.  He's patient (he used to teach kids) and doesn't rush the lessons.  He also provides notes for home practice.  Overall, I had a good experience and would recommend this place for anyone looking to take guitar lessons downtown.

13.description: A great option for working professionals in the city! My instructor - Forrest is proficient, knowledgeable and great teachers - the real deal. There are three key factors that makes this ideal for the working professional:1. Personalized lessons - They match you with an instructor based on what you want to learn and where you want to take your guitar skills. This is important given that you are allocating a limited amount of time out of your busy week towards this so you want to focus on what you are interested in. They are very good about this and the instructors are very open to customizing the lessons based on the styles you want to learn2. Instructor quality and focus on fundamentals - Instructors interested in teaching you things the right way and explaining the why as well as the how. 3. Flexibility of Schedule - Given my travel / commute heavy schedule, this was important. Great work Guitar Chicago. Looking forward to another great year and seeing you guys expand!

4.description: I have been taking lessons from Dan for more than two and a half years and it something I look forward to every week.  Aside from being a great teacher, he is fun, understanding and very talented.  He takes the time to help you understand the structure of what you are learning without over burdening you with theory.  He is also really interested in making sure you are enjoying playing (that is the point) and getting out of it exactly what you want.  Any time I have a request (no matter how absurd) of a song to learn, Dan takes the time to find a good arrangement at my level and teaches it to me.  It is really nice having that flexibility and personal investment in my lessons.  In just two and a half years, I went from playing no to guitar to be comfortable jamming with my friends while also developing my classical guitar playing skills.  This blend of genres and talents truly sets Dan a part and I would encourage anyone looking to finally learn the guitar to sign up for lessons with Dan.

6.description: I started taking guitar classes 2 weeks ago and have really enjoyed it.  Forrest has been my instructor so far and he doesn't assume you know anything and also doesn't talk to you like you are dumb.  He asks what you want to know, what you already know and what you want to learn and goes from there.It has been really good and he will break you of all your bad habits, which is great to have.  Look for groupons because they are out there from time to time.  30 minutes goes by really fast and I wish it was a little longer, but I think that is the standard.

15.description: Perfect. When I started lessons I just wanting to play a few tunes...forget that, I am learning to play lead guitar. Jim has a balanced approach to teaching and learning, ensuring every aspect is covered and understood. It has inspired my creative side. Now I own three guitars and recently started with bass lessons. Most of all, I am having fun. Blues and Rock are my interests and Chicago Guitar is my place to learn.

7.description: So, I have now been taking lessons for more than 1 1/2 years at Guitar Cities (Chicago), and I love it more now than I did when I first started!  My skill has progressed nicely, and I'm happy and pleasantly surprised at how much I have learned and continue to learn week after week.  Jim is an outstanding instructor who offers top-notch skill, patience (much needed in my case), humor, and a lot of encouragement!  I couldn't be happier.  I love it so much, I am now also adding Ukelele to my repertoire, in addition to acoustic guitar.However, when I took a new job 40 miles away, the commute was literally inducing psychotic levels of road rage.  So in an effort to save my sanity, I began to take my lessons over Skype more than a year ago and it has been great!  There are absolutely NO issues with taking lessons online vs. in-person, and I have never felt like I wasn't getting as much out of the interaction.  Now it doesn't matter where you live, because technology can bridge the gap and make it possible for everyone!  I HIGHLY recommend lessons with Guitar Chicago for anyone and everyone...give them a try!!!

8.description: I've spent a significant portion of my short life looking back on great guitarists in reverent awe. Richards, Page, Hendrix, Townsend, Clapton, Allman and Young are among the masterful deities I continue to look towards for inspiration. My attempt to mimic their craft alone was met with frustration, despair and often failure before finally giving in, as so many aspirational musicians eventually do.It was not until a friend recommended I check out Guitar Chicago that I dusted off my cheap Epiphone to climb back on the Steel Horse (Bon Jovi, what a gifted poet). I met with Jason, who came highly recommended. Jason has the ability to help demystify the guitar with a strong background in Jazz and a firm grip on musical theory. He's equally skilled and comfortable going through chord patterns, technique and odd Jazz rhythms as he is deconstructing a Kiss song.My goal in taking lessons was to make myself comfortable enough to play a few songs without too much butchering. Jason has helped me reach a level of comfort where I can plug my crappy guitar into my less crappy computer and record myself playing. I feel much more comfortable with the instrument than I did only a year ago.The location is great, the scheduling is flexible, online payment takes no time at all and perhaps best of all, you don't need to bring your guitar. I often leave each half hour lesson feeling accomplished and hungry for more guitar. Jason and Guitar Chicago continues to contribute to my early onset of arthritis and I couldn't be happier.

3.description: I needed to do an update to give credit when credit is due. After my situation my trainer Dan contacted me and gracefully apologized and made up for the mistake. I am a firm believer in mistakes can happen and the way you rebound from them measures your skills. I am back in class and still learning at a fast pace. As I wrote originally I could have just had bad luck in the beginning and it turns out I did. I am happy with the way they handled the situation and got me back on track. So I do recommend Guitar Cities for their professionalism and especially the trainer Dan.

14.description: Not having a musical background, and being a more "mature" student, I'd been happy with learning to play the guitar in a group, assuming I may slowly progress with persistence.  However, after a few lessons with Jim, I was energized and convinced that I could stretch the limits much farther.  Jim does a terrific job teaching fundamentals, which I really needed, and music theory in a logical fashion, and at the same time he keeps it fun.  The environment at Guitar Chicago is conducive to learning, and Jim's program and style  is tailored to an individual's level and musical interests.   Half hour lessons are very effective, especially when you follow the recommended practice exercises.  I'm very happy with my Guitar Chicago experience and highly recommend it to anyone that wants to be challenged in a very positive way.

3.description: La Baguette has a pretty good selection of breads (both french and bolillos), last time I was there they had some with cheese and jalapeños.  They also have donuts, churros, cookies (large and small), a decent selection of pan mexicano, pastries, cake slices, whole cakes, or you can order specialty cakes for your special event.  They also sell seasonal items like pan de reyes.I will admit, when it comes to baked goods, I am really picky and I tend to like certain things from certain places.  Why?  Who knows..but I will say that from La Baguette Bakery I really like their mini chocolate chip cookies and their long french bread.  Everything else here, to me, is pretty average and I probably have had better at another bakery.  Not that it's bad, it's just that I've had better.What I really like is that the staff is very friendly, and I also like that they are very generous with samples.  For me, however, those little chocolate chip cookies are where it's at...addicting!:)

1.description: My son had a taste for Churros. To our surprise they had churros here. They where very good! Not too sweet or greasy. My son loved them. I bought also some other sweets and I wasn't so impressed. When I  come to these bakeries I have to try their Conchitas and puerquitos (kind of ginger bread that's a shape of pig). The puerquitos tasted bland and the Conchitas need more love. One thing I like in particular from this place is that they make bolillo ( stuffed baguette) stuffed with cream cheese and jalapeño. It seems that the bolillo is stuffed before it gets cooked...so good! I'll definitely come here again for the bolillo and churros but I'll stat away from the puerquitos and Conchitas.

2.description: Great selection of cake and pastries for cheap. If you don't want the whole cake they have slices as well.  I wish they had some spicy dishes as well like Samosa etc. Customer service is usually very good. Did I say it is inexpensive?

9.description: If you've never visited a mexican bakery, this is a great one as you can try many things for little money.  The cookies have a very specific sandy, sugary texture that is occasionally good.  This is not the realm for those seeking the ideal homemade tasting cookie, but a person should make sure to try one in their life just to know what it's about.   They seem to always be open (except for like 12am) with columns of trans fat laden goods waiting to be tried.  Go with $5 and you'll carry out a bag of stuff.

10.description: always sound the same but.............i love this place my fav goddys  are here never have a bad experience cakes are delicious.evrething in general  my daugther al ready tell me mom my cake i wanted from this bakery please............ and i  said of course my dear :)

4.description: Obviously I should have checked out reviews on the mobile app before visiting but my 3GS iPhone is sucking and I'm finding that hard to do these days.  Bakery items are inexpensive.  I got a mildly sweet gelatin cup and two doughy donuts for about four dollars and some change.  It was a later Sunday evening and we were looking for a sweet something after enjoying some wings up the street at Take Me Out.  Speaking of which, I'd  called over here some forty minutes before visiting inquiring as to whether they carried churros and if so, whether they were filled and which flavors.  The person that answered spoke little English so it took some time to get it figured out.  She said they offered it in two flavors, vanilla and strawberry.  She then asked how many I needed and responded that they had more than enough.  Cool.Well, unfortunately the counter person tells me they have never carried churros with filling.  What? Why does it have a hole in the center then?  I got the number for them from the front door when I drove past earlier. Almost makes me wonder if the number connected to another one of their many locations. Ugh.  They keep free samples of churros on the counter and these were served plain.  Even the ones in the bakery case were plain.  The donuts I'd ordered were decent, just something better than Dunkin' Donuts but nothing too impressive.  If you like doughy, you'll dig these and at eighty cents each, it's not bad.  I probably should have ordered some breads and would've been a bunch more happy about the visit.  Even on this slow Sunday evening they were fully stocked with numerous breads, donuts, sweets, cake slices, fresh made flan in a refrigerated case and other pudding like desserts served in cups.Parking is available out front on the street.  Also there is a small alley which runs along the side of the building and towards a narrow alley that goes around back and winds you around to the main street.  Street parking is best.

6.description: I student taught in a first grade classroom where one of the girls told me she wanted to be a La Baguette when she grew up.Of course, she doesn't want to be a french bread roll.  She was referring to one of these spots - according to their website there are 11 around Chicago(land).They make this custard filled pastry cornocopia looking thing that is to die for.  Also good: empanadas de camote (sweet potato), other empanadas, and their raisin bread pudding.  Cheap cinamonny coffee (any self respecting Mexican bakery must sell it).  My sister likes their conchas.Of course, it probably depends on when you go - like any bakery, stuff can get a little less than fresh as the day goes on.  So be smart about it guys.One thing folks should be aware of regarding any legit Mexican bakery - they use lard, quite a bit.  Ask about it before you assume vegetarian.I like this place over other comparable Mexican bakeries because they *DO* take plastic!

12.description: this place is INSANE. so many delicious sugary treats! cookies, cakes, cupcakes...anything you can imagine! such beautiful cakes! they have this cupcake...that's LOOKS like a hostess chocolate cupcake...but is 10000 times better.there's custard everywhere! and in everything! try the "horn of plenty." you'll know it when you see it.and if you are lost, and can't find this place...just look for the mural on the side of the building...a mural of THE WARRIORS!! i KNOW!! UNREAL!!

5.description: This is the ultimate spot to quench your thirst for anything sweet, homemade, and purely delicious!   I actually stumbled upon La Baguette from a last-minute cake rush yesterday! I originally went to Nuevo Leon to pick up a Tres Leches cake, but they were out of 10" cakes so they sent me down the road to La Baguette!   This Mexican bakery is AMAZING - packed with over 60 types of wholesome, authentic Mexican pastries! Let's start with the cakes (my primary objective for the evening). I have been searching for the best value Tres Leches cake in town since I moved to Chicago almost a year ago... all the bakeries on 18th St / in Pilsen are amazing, no doubt.  But a wide selection of over 7 flavors that's fresh-yet-ready-on-shelf for your last minute rush, at a great PRICE?  No place like La Baguette!!  When I walked in to the store around 6:30pm last night, the store had over 7 different varieties of cakes in the display fridge.  They had Tres Leches en Mocha / Kahlua / Pina Colada in 3 sizes ($28, $35, $42), another 2 chocolate flavored cakes and 2 more traditional cakes that I didn't note the flavors! There are over 2 dozens per-slice cakes as well, if you are just looking to try different flavors (oooh the flaaaaan!)After I chose my bday cake, I had the time to really look around & take in the store.  Woah. Now that's a lot of pastries all in 1 spot! The moment you walk in the store, you can pick up round metal pans + tongs to make your selection. They had at least 3-4 rows of breads, empanadas, cookies, churros, pound-cakes, torta breads and much much more!  Not everything was decked out in sugar though, you can buy breads for daily meals to be used in tortas or sandwiches, and the empanadas had fresh, jam-like fruit fillings. Not to mention all the exotic flavors you can get (Mango/Pineapple/Guava anyone?)I slowly made my round and picked up plenty of treats for the next week (remember, I only came in to get a Tres Leches cake). At the counter, the cashiers were super friendly and chatted about their favorite pastries in the store! The cake was wrapped & ready to go!At the birthday party, everyone's eyes were glued to my Tres Leches en Pina Colada cake... it was a beauty ;)  The ladies from La Baguette had threw in some candles, a slicing knife & written the birthday boy's name + "Feliz Cumpleanos" on the cake!  The cake was juicy & moist from the tres leches cream, and just enough whipped cream on top! I will definitely be back to La Baguette for another birthday cake =)  They take custom orders for large parties too! -- Signs on the wall states they can make cakes for parties of 30-50 people! Now THAT'S what I called a great selection ;)

13.description: this place rocks, but it's just way to much SUGAR! I always want everything in sight!! Good stuff tho'

11.description: I hate this bakery. We just wanted to pick up some desert. Maybe a cookie, a pastry or two...but noooooo! They've got to have so much crap to choose from. They have to bend our will and force us, at gunpoint, to purchase enough delicious, yummy...you get the idea. Oh and it's pretty damn cheap to boot. Not recommended for anyone on a diet.

8.description: This bakery is delicious and has so much to choose from. Their selection is huge for different types of cookies, cakes, and pastries, so I like to try new things each time that I go. After having been there a few times, one of the people working there started recognizing me. Knowing that I like to try new things, she handed me half an extra pastry to try for free, which I thought was really thoughtful of her and showed good customer service.

0.description: I had a cake was so good and the lady works there was very nice. My son was with me and she carried the cake to car for me.

7.description: I am so glad I don't live near a bakery this good! I would easily gain 50 pounds just from smelling the delicious pastries inside.La Baguette can be a little overwhelming when you first step inside, especially if it is your first time. Just grab a tray and a set of tongs and start piling on the goods.And trust me, everything is good. And cheap! So go ahead and pile those donuts, cookies, and baked goods onto your tray. And the fat onto your hips.

1.description: There was lots of variety. As, I perused the menu. The plates were generous, but the food was at room temperature.  The prices were incredible. We left here full, a bit heavier. .......but happy...

0.description: Best place for fresh barbeque! Love their carnitas too!

3.description: I got some chocolate from here from my friend and it was amazing! Their was nothing wrong with it. It was just perfect in every way.It tasted good outside and inside.My friend also told me that it didn't cost him much to get this candy!

1.description: Maybe I'm having a Chocolate Fit. But my candy was good and yummy yummy.. The lady at the counter was very nice she told me that I would like my turtles and I did. She even gave me 1 to taste. Cute little shop service with a smile. And lots of treats..I'll be back.

2.description: This is a great place to get bulk penny candy, nuts, dried fruit and chocolate. They have boxes of loose snacks and they scoop it out and weigh & price it for you. Outlet prices on the packs of snacks you typically find on the peg boards at the checkout . The stock is fresh and priced better than you can find anywhere.
